Reviews.Title: “Spring break trip”
Reviews.Author: Allison R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and clean. The staff was very polite and answered any questions we had. I thought the location was ideal because it's only two blocks from Seattle Center and that's where we were doing most of our activities. It's also not that far of a walk down to the piers, it took us only about 20 minutes. The neighborhood didn't seem sketchy or bad and the hotel had cameras and you had to use your room key to get in the front door after a certain time. The view from the rooftop deck is quite nice if you manage to go up on a nice day. I think that the only complaint that I have is that all the pillows that they have there are too soft and some kind of down or synthetic down.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: vcarley
Reviews.Content: Location was the best thing about this hotel. Easy walk to Space Needle and Monorail to downtown. Neighborhood was fun. A definite plus that Safeway was just across the street. One negative thing was that we had to pay for internet in the room, which just seems petty in this day and age. Otherwise very clean, friendly, and a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Its 4 circles if you want an extended stay type and not full service”
Reviews.Author: Ivebeeneverywhere12
Reviews.Content: Its less if you expect room service and a feeling like your in a "nice" hotel. Didnt know it was more of an extended stay place until stayed there,they have monthly rates etc. It is in an OK lower Queen Anne neighborhood close to the Seattle Center and places to eat. Also, , but our room happened to be right by a Noisy Generator or something and as Ive been told alot of the rooms dont have AC It would have been REALLY loud ifwe had to open the windows in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Completely impressed”
Reviews.Author: viajera511
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay in lower Queen Anne and I was becoming dismayed about the hotel options until I discovered the Mediterranean Inn. I was really impressed with this hotel. The staff was really courteous and helpful. When I arrived from a long flight, the receptionist didn't bat an eye when I asked if I could microwave some food I had brought with me on the plane because I was famished. Another staff member printed out the bus schedule when I needed to go downtown. The room itself was great. The bed was comfortable and the heating system was good. I loved the rooftop view. The only drawbacks were a high surcharge for Wifi ($5/day are you kidding?!) but the Business Center with multiple computers and printers were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: EmilyandSam
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Seattle for 29 years, I never had a personal need to stay at a hotel. Since we have moved away, I stayed at the Inn recently on a trip back to Seattle. For $84/night, you really can't beat that rate! The hotel is located on lower Queen Anne. Queen Anne is the neighborhood next to downtown Seattle, so a great, vibrant neighborhood close to everything. Easy access to I-5, a quick bus ride/walk/cab to downtown Seattle (less than 2 miles), a block from Key Area, and maybe only a mile to the Seattle waterfront. Queen Anne is divided into 2 neighborhoods - upper and lower Queen Anne. Both parts of "the hill" have great restaurants and cute shops, but lower Queen Anne has a younger, more urban vibe while upper Queen Anne is more residential. The hotel room was clean, service was friendly, but the hotel is relatively no frills. I may have a different opinion if I had visited the rooftop deck, which looks pretty amazing from the pictures on Trip Advisor. The window in my room looked into other rooms. It was a little disappointing that wi-fi was not free, as I feel like so many hotels offer free wi-fi now. I did really love the Starbucks access from the lobby - a true sign you're in Seattle! I believe parking was $15, and I recommend it, as parking is scarce since this hotel is so close to Key Arena and downtown. Some great places in the neighborhood are Peso's or Laredo's (both are Mexican restaurants with fun bars), The Great Nabob for a neighborhood bar with good local beer on tap, The Sitting Room for a cozy glass of wine and European-style hors d'oeuvres, and don't forget 2 Seattle institutions for casual dining - Pagliacci's Pizza and Dick's Drive-In hamburgers... both within a block of the Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: misharpittman
Reviews.Content: We arrived a little early but they went out of their way to let us check in early,parking in alley behind with secure gates and you use a card key to gain entry.The rooms are smaller but very clean and they have nice beds with Starbucks coffee and Tazo tea in the room and pop corn with bottled water.This hotel is decorated very nice and is very clean with a Starbucks adjacent to the lobby, Hey that must mean it is Seattle!!!!But the location is great to sight see and the bus system is available and lots of taxis everywhere so do not hesitate this place is GREAT.You can grab the monorail also but parking downtown can add up pretty fast so taking transit is a great option

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NorthwestCoaster
Reviews.Content: Two blocks away from Key Arena was the selling point for us to stay here. Having a Starbucks in the lobby and a Dick's restaurant across the street were both a bonus. Modern room was very small with built in seating but having a kitchenette with a grocery store nearby helped to suit our needs. Rooftop patio had a good view of the water. Staff was very helpful and nice with the free use of computers. Parking was expensive but worth it to not have to leave our vehicle on the street overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel for a family trip!”
Reviews.Author: DanielleDes
Reviews.Content: We stayed four days in this charming, well placed hotel. We easily walked every day to Seattle Center, where the Space Needle, Pacific Science Center, EMP Museum, and the monorail are. To get to Pike Place Market downtown, we just took the monorail. Also close to several delicious restaurants - go down two blocks to Toulouse Petit; it was amazing creole breakfast, just delicious, and such a fun atmosphere! The hotel itself was well-kept, clean, comfortable, and the staff was super friendly and helpful. Our teenage daughters were completely charmed with the place and now insist that this be our hotel every time we visit Seattle. :)

Reviews.Title: “Location, service, comfort”
Reviews.Author: Susannah M
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Mediterranean Inn but it is now my go-to accommodation in Seattle. The rooms and common areas were clean, functional and comfortable and the staff friendly, helpful and fun to talk to. The roof-top terrace has a great view and this hotel even rents bikes, complete with helmets! The mini-kitchen in the room is a great plus when on the road, the neighborhood is full of little restaurants and it is walking distance from Seattle Center, downtown, Pike Place Market and the waterfront. A huge advantage are the windows that open, meaning you don't rely on artificial ventilation. That clinched the deal for me on paper, but the experience means that I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “quiet little inn”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: Nice ambiance. Older hotel but very comfortable and great neighborhood to walk in. Market, drugstore, restaurants, museums, movie, Space needle, bay-all within walking distance. Area recommendations Spaceneedle for the awesome view of the city at night. Use public transportation to downtown/stadium/Pike Place market. Take State Ferrie to Bainbridge Island

Reviews.Title: “A great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Sewonforever
Reviews.Content: I pass through Seattle regularly but had never stayed here before, I was delightfully surprised by this hotel and would stay here again. There is a Starbucks with access off the hotel lobby and a Safeway within walking distance. The Secure parking did cost more but it usually does - was nice that the elevator went down to the parking and made loading the car very easy! The refrigerator, microwave and sink area were great and made the visit much more comfortable. The hotel was very quiet and I could see the space needle out my room window. The windows open for fresh air and the hotel staff was delightful! A wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: traintraveller155004
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at the Mediterranean Inn having booked it through my airplane booking. The room was quiet with a small kitchen area - sink, fridge, microwave and coffee maker - all very comfortable. I noticed there was an extra charge for use of the WiFi which is unusual these days but there is an excellent business centre with printers down stairs which is free and a Starbucks on the premises with WiFi so I simply used these. The desk staff was most friendly and helpful with maps and information. When the fire alarm in the room started to beep it was fixed right away. What I most appreciated what happened after I had checked out. As my train left late in the day, they checked my baggage into a secure area. I have a medical condition which rarely bothers me - as luck would have it, it did that day. I needed to go back three times to my luggage - the desk staff couldn't have been more helpful, considerate and tactful, When next I am back in Seattle I will certainly stay at the Mediterranean Inn,

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: rulalinska
Reviews.Content: My son moved to the Lower Queen Anne section of Seattle last year. I've visited twice and stayed at the Mediterranean both times. An early arrival from the airport left us with time to kill before our check-in. The staff was very accomodatiing and let us store our bags until our room was ready. The rooms were comfortable and I would recommend a room facing the courtyard for light sleepers. It was great having a Starbucks right off the hotel lobby too. The hotel location is wonderful, within acouple blocks of the Seattle Center, the Space Needle and the monorail which makes for an easy trip into downtown. Belltown and many good eateries are within walking distance too. We had a definite favorite, Toulouse Petit, which had amazing breakfasts!. Don't miss the view from the hotel deck! One morning I had the pleasure of sipping my Starbucks while watching the sunrise present a fantastic view of Mt. Rainier.

Reviews.Title: “Had to plunge toilet...”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_AAustralia
Reviews.Content: Arrived to Seattle after a long trip, room clean and spacious on arrival, small kitchenette, with microwave, sink and fridge, no utensils so kitchenette becomes some what useless as we do not travel with knives, forks or spoons. When my partner flushed the toilet for the first time it was half a centimeter from overflowing filled with toilet paper. Rang the front desk to which I was informed that there was no "maintence person" on duty and that I could come down and get a plunger to plunge the toilet myself! I had to get dressed out of my pjs and go to the front lobby not one of the staff who was working at the time offered to come up and assist with the toilet and I had to ask if the toliet was not fixed could we swap rooms. They said they would swap us to another room, but as we were jet lagged and had already unpacked our things and stocked up the fridge with fruit and water it was not an option at that time of night. So I plunged and fixed the toilet myself and then had to walk down to return the plunger. In the morning I requested to speak to the manager to inform her of the situation but she was unavailable at the time. Staff were not sympathetic or apologetic to the situation until I requested to speak to the manager it was then that one of the employees apologized and as compensation wiped the Internet room fee of 4.95 so I now find the matter settled with the apology. But it does bring me to all the hidden costs, on arrival we were not informed of the rewards program in which you are charged for Internet, movies, to use the roof top access, use of the gym, coffee in the room ect. This all came to 8 dollars per day and it is written on a card that is left if your room. How ever this is very confusing and unclear I then took is card down to the lobby and even the girl at the desk agreed that it was confusing we were not getting charged this and most of the amenities on the card are free of charge such as accessing the roof and using the gym but the rest of it you do get charged for. I find it very confusing and unclear and I think the hotel need to clarify all is with guests when they arrive. The reason I rated this so low is the fact that I had to plunge the toilet myself, I had to ask twice before someone could look at the toilet and then someone only came and took a two second look the next evening! Not impressed at all. Only plus side to this hotel is that there is a Starbucks attached, dicks burger place across the road and a little independent cinema across the road they were all fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: bunchacrazies
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd - maybe 4th - time I've stayed here. You can walk to the city center & monorail, then get downtown within minutes. Excellent restaurants in this neighborhood, grocery store around the corner. Anything you need is within minutes walking. Starbucks right off the lobby ~ I love that. :) (Another coffee shop right down the block if you don't like SB) Staff is helpful & friendly. Rooms are clean. On-site parking is a must for me. Added parking & entrance security is great. There aren't kid activities in the hotel, but again, walking distance to the City Center, so there really doesn't need to be. Movie theater right down the block. DVD player in each room, access to internet & DVD collection for a small fee. Exercise facility, bike rentals. Very full-faceted & unique place to stay. Rooftop offers a 360 view of Seattle & bay area. I love this hotel and I would stay there as business, family, friends, or even by myself.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time in Seattle, Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Rexoy
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time to visit Seattle, by staying at the Meditterranean Inn, I got to enjoy Seattle to the fullest. Great value for the price, wonderful view from the roof deck, a great place to enjoy your coffee, which you can buy at starbucks near the hotel lobby. I was able to enjoy the wonderful places to eat in the vicinity of the inn. Walking distance to the space needle and it's surrounding areas. From the space needle, downtown is easily accessible by monorail. An alternative transportation would be by bike, compliments of the inn, I think I got a package deal for my stay. Staff was courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, clean, friendly and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Jenny l
Reviews.Content: First time staying at this hotel. Great place, clean rooms, staff is helpful and friendly. Single bed rooms are a bit small, but not a real point of concern as it was very comfortable, complete with a mini kitchen with fridge and microwave. Parking fee was reasonable and secure ($15/night) as opposed to many other downtown hotels ($30-$45/night!) Location is walking distance from really great restaurants, Space Needle and a short taxi ride to all other downtown Seattle locations. Really great place, would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: canadianpotter
Reviews.Content: Great downtown location with kitchen facilities in downtown Seattle. Major grocery store accross the street. Many restaurants and a bank nearby. Friendly, helpful staff. Waterfront is an easy walk downhill. Plan to stay there next time we are in downtown Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Budget-Friendly and Just Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Victoria H
Reviews.Content: The Mediterranean Inn Hotel is located just one block from Key Arena and the Space Needle on Queen Anne North in downtown Seattle within walking distance to many attractions. While the boutique-style hotel’s accommodations are limited, the rooms are incredibly clean and the staff is friendly and helpful! The cheery yellow hotel offers sun-drenched rooms with out-swinging windows that open so you can enjoy the fresh Pacific Northwest air. The hotel also offers an onsite Starbucks and pay bicycle rentals. During my stay, the staff was extremely pleasant suggesting unique, “local” venues for dining and helpful directions for site-seeing. The Mediterranean Inn Hotel is ideal for the budget-conscious traveler who enjoys city sight-seeing by foot and wants a centralized location but still enjoys comfort at the end of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel/Inn-Convenient Location, secure parking”
Reviews.Author: TradingPlaces4fun
Reviews.Content: Best kept secret in Seattle! What a pleasant surprise, I was looking for something on a budget that had a great location near to city center, with a secure parking garage, well equiped business center, gym and located in a safe area. Bingo! It's no frills, but very comfortable and charming with a European flare. The rooms were well equipped with kitchenettes, coffee maker, fridge with complementary bottled water, microwave w/ popcorn. (Safeway Market across the street) House keeping did a great job. Staff was helpful, the business center was the best I've seen-complementary -several HP computers with internet access, printers, fax, copiers-no waiting.There's a great roof top deck with a panorama view of Elliott Bay and down town Seattle- one of the only hotels in Seattle to have a roof top deck. Great location! The Mediterranean Inn is just a short 5-10 minute walk to Key arena, Seattle Center (Space Needle, monorail, museums etc.) It's in a cute part of town with an abundance of cafe's, bistros and shopping nearby, plus there's a Starbucks adjacent to the hotel lobby. To save $ I booked with Travelocity for $70. per night, which was quite a bit less than booking with the hotel directly. Great value! I'll be back and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, close to Downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Chur
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel, close enough to Downtown (5 min walk to Seattle Centre where you can take the Monorail to Downtown), and with great restaurants nearby (specially Toulouse Little Kitchen, a small Greek place and the Irish pub opposite Easy St. Records). Staff is very friendly and you have a cracking view of Seattle (day and night) at the rooftop terrace. Also very convenient for the Seahawks game as we took a bus a block from the hotel and took us to the ground very easily.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and secure parking.”
Reviews.Author: Jane A
Reviews.Content: We try a different hotel or B & B almost everytime we are in Seattle (about 5 times a year), so this was a first stay at this hotel. I can say with confidence that it won't be the last. It has many good things to offer from our point of view. Secure underground, gated parking is a starter. The many decent restaurants in the Queen Anne neighbourhood are a plus, not to mention that in poor weather you don't even need to go outside to enter the adjoining Starbucks. We like that the area actually has residences while also being close to the downtown. We love to walk, and therefore found it quite easy to walk to Pike's market, and even on to Century Link Field. The hotel itself has friendly staff, a fittness room, a business centre, and even laundary facilites for guests. It is clean and affordable too. Definitely worth a try!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Atl30309
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel in Queen Anne neighborhood. Close to restaurants, shops, public transportation and two blocks from Seattle Center. Clean, efficiently designed rooms and excellent staff. Microwave and refrigerator in room and Starbucks shop off lobby. Around the corner from supermarket and two blocks from 24hour drug store and supermarket. Parking garage on site-$15 per day- is very tight.

Reviews.Title: “So Cute! Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: drewsmom50304
Reviews.Content: First of all, although this hotel is smaller than the big name brand hotels, you can't beat the location, price and friendly staff. When I first saw the pics on-line I was skeptical until we drove by and was delighted that the hotel lit up the street. If you book online, you can find incredible deals with this hotel and if you want to extend your stay, the hotel staff is more than willing to match the online price! Two blocks away from the needle and city center. Also, the street that this hotel is on (Queen Anne) has a sprinkle of unbelievable restaurants and bars where you won't need to hail a taxi to get to. Two of which are featured in some publications as one of the best restaurants in the city. We visit Seattle twice a year and we will definitely stay here again. * probably the only con is that this hotel does not have air-conditioning so we shall see what it will be like in the summer. However is Seattle and it doesn't get that hot that we would be uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Queen Anne area”
Reviews.Author: LoveLondon3
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here for our girls weekend in Seattle. Neither of us had ever been and didn't know the area or what to expect, but we loved this little hotel and the price was unbelievable!! We spent two nights here and the front desk staff was beyond amazing and so helpful - with recommendations on restaurants, places of interest, transportation, and all of our other random questions we seemed to have each day. I would say the staff is what made this stay so amazing! The room was very nice - good size bathroom, plus a small kitchenette. Very quiet area of town with easy access to the buses. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to all of my friends and family! Great, great stay at the Mediterranean!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kat M
Reviews.Content: I think we paid $80 per night for a king room on the 4th floor. The rooms were clean and normal sized. The bed was comfortable. Wireless internet was $5 per day so we didn't bother. Underground parking was $15 per day. We elected to park on the street and pay $3 for 2 hours at a meter during the day because we were heading out in the car frequently. The hotel is in a great location, a short drive to everything and a few good restaurants in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected delight”
Reviews.Author: coriejim
Reviews.Content: We traveled all morning in heavy rain, excessive traffic, arriving early in afternoon very tired and hungry... We were greeted by friendly staff, parking was easily accessible in an underground lot, and our room was ready for occupancy. Although the amenities quite basic we found the hotel clean, our room quiet and relaxing with a great view of Elliott Bay. We were able to walk to most of our destinations downtown, finding great places to eat and explore without getting tangled in the crazy Seattle traffic. Furthermore, the price was excellent. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: karsychan
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, Seattle center is just a few blocks away, it has an awesome roof deck view, it has coin operated washing machines inside the hotel for your convenience, a Safeway supermarket is just on the next block. Pike place market is a bit of a distance to walk but you can take the bus that runs practically in front of the hotel. the room can be a little cleaner and it does get a little noisy if you're staying on the lower floors but it's a great place to stay for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “3 reasons.......”
Reviews.Author: Oziwi
Reviews.Content: 3 reasons not to stay at the Mediterranean Inn: 1: Customer service 2: Noise 3: Location Arrived in Seattle after a very long trip, tired & in need of a shower, decided to head to the hotel to drop our bags off, not expecting to check in as it was 11.30am. This seemed ok & we were told our room would be ready by 12.30pm,come back then. On return at 2.pm we were told to wait, our room was not ready. 2 hrs later, after watching people check in, walk in off the street & get rooms, several visits to reception to enquire on our room, falling asleep in the foyer we were finally 'allowed to enter". Would it have been so difficult for this hotel to change our room & give us a room already prepared. This hotel was clearly not full. To see others walk in off the street & go straight to a room was not a good first impression. Unfortunately airlines do not cater their flights to hotel check in times. Maybe its time hotels showed a little understanding towards those on long distance flights? Afterall we pay for it! And we go away informing others on our travels & at home as to how we are treated. This reflects not only on the hotel but on the city itself. My partner & I both felt the customer service for the duration of our stay (4 nights) was not only poor but quite rude. Listening to the conversations whist we were waiting a pattern started to emerge. American travellers were spoken/treated to in a cheerful, polite & helpful manner. international - sullen, unhelpful & unfriendly. On the plus side: room was large & clean. Bed was very comfortable & linen spotless. There was a kitchenette, though this did not supply any utensils - can cook in the microwave but need to visit the supermarket across the road to purchase said. Bathroom was clean but shower/water pressure poor. The rooftop view is lovely & a nice place to coffee/wine & nibble if warm enough. Starbucks can be accessed from the hotel foyer which is convienent. The noise in this hotel is incredible. Our room was in front of the elevators. All night we could hear the lifts moving & the doors opening/closing as well as other guests talking/yelling in the hallways. The walls are paper thin, we were distrubed by the guests upstairs & next door thumping around, everytime they used the toilet we could actually hear & even somone snoring. Traffic noise, buses/trucks early in the morning was awful. This was our first trip to Seattle. If i returned I would definately stay closer to the city. It is just too far out. Most of the sights are in the city area. There is a monorail to the Spaceneedle which we used, it is a short walk to the hotel from there. Buses are available but it seemed that we spent all our time in the city & could have just had a day looking around the Queen Ann area. Pike place market, Space needle & walking the waterfront are all worth doing. We caught the bus to Museum of Aviation. Locals assisted us to find right buses & the drivers were friendly & helpful. Museum was a highlight, this is really worth a look. We also visited the Gold Rush Museum & Fire Museum. Both worth a look if you are wandering around the city with no plans. Lovely staff ready to answer any questions. The Underground Tour was a little lame but we did enjoy due to the guides involved. Hilarious banter. These guides certainly made up for the lack of "views' with their ability to spin a tale & interact with the group. This tour is very busy, so book in advance.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Place with a Great Rooftop Deck”
Reviews.Author: TravelerNaomi
Reviews.Content: We found their price reasonable compared to many others in Seattle during the time we were travelling. We found cheaper prices for their rooms on a travel site than on their own site - I called and received an additional discount by booking directly over the phone. Their price does not include a resort fee of around $8/day at the time of this posting. The rooms were adequate - partially upgraded with granite counters, but older comforters and a shower so weak it was like a garden gnome spitting on you (the sole reason why I have rated this hotel as average). The rooftop deck was worth it all, with beautiful views. A Starbucks is connected to the hotel (great for morning coffee on the rooftop deck) and there are many good restaurants and bars within walking distance. There is a grocery store about 1 block away and rooms come with refrigerators and coffee makers. Taxi's are reasonable into downtown and Pike Place, if you don't want to walk the roughly 2.5 miles or so. The space needle is walking distance as well, maybe 1 mile. The area is in transition, so there are some vagrants on the streets, which were not a clean as I imagined Seattle - though this is no reflection on the hotel. Staff was friendly. Free internet in the lobby and free printing as well (because you already paid the resort fee). A small workout room is available and I believe they have parking, though I do not know if that is for an additional charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Happy7654
Reviews.Content: We arrived after walking six blocks from bus line just we did on purpose as we are taking Dave Ramsey, Financial Peace at our church and we are taking saving $$$ seriously these days. Reception was very efficient nice and accommodating staff. Room is a bit retro but it made me think of my aunt Hazel's cozy house in Glendale, Ca years ago. Anyway, we took Monorail to Pike's Market. Had lunch at Athenians where clam chowder was great. Found out about Safeway 2 blocks from Mediterranean Inn and since there is microwave were able to have first dinner inside. Probably some street noise but I always bring ear plugs so had no problem with comfortable sleep. Good value and great time.

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop deck, location and friendly staff worth the price of admission alone!”
Reviews.Author: Jessicahorani
Reviews.Content: I just spent 3 nights at the Mediterranean Inn while attending an ABA conference downtown at the Hyatt Olive 8 and I'm so glad I decided to go with my gut and pick the smaller, less corporate Mediterranean Inn in the amazing Queen Anne neighborhood (Lower Queen Anne to be exact) rather than spending all my time at the Hyatt downtown. The staff could not have been friendlier or more accommodating and the price was a great value! My room was a King bed room with a small kitchenette and a window seat and while not fancy inside it was more than appropriate for my needs. The rooftop deck is amazing! Great, scenic views that are yours for free (I skipped the tourist lines at the Space Needle and just relaxed in an Adirondack chair on the roof and got a similar view!) The location is also great; one of the best Cajun brunch places is right up the street, Toulouse Petit, which was recommended to me by a local and did not disappoint; Easy Street Records, where you can get your Seattle Nirvana/Pearl Jam fix; Metropolitan Market, a 24 hour 'Whole Foods Style' grocery; and more are all within a few blocks of the hotel and the monorail to head downtown is just a few more blocks away. I headed out from the hotel a few times to go run and it's a short distance down Queen Anne Avenue N. to Denny Ave/St (?) where you can head to the right and go down to the Olympic sculpture park and run along the water. For a real run, keep going along the running/bike trails and head up north to Discovery Park which was amazing with a 2.8 mile loop trail with smaller more difficult single track trails heading off down to the beaches. If you head up the steep hill of Queen Ave. N. northbound you will come to Kerry park and the gorgeous homes on the hill of W. Highland Drive. Bring your camera! I can't say enough good things about Seattle, the Mediterranean Inn and my experience there and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: JoeFargo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few nights in October. I got a pretty good hotel/air rate from Expedia and in my opinion this a nice hotel for the price. I would definitely stay here again. Very practical rooms but nothing fancy. I had a corner 3rd floor corner room and had nice views to the west and north. I would not recommend staying here in the summer if it's hot because there is no A/C. The room had a nice kitchenette. Across street is a Safeway and attached to hotel is a Starbucks. The roof top deck has a great view of downtown and Olympic mountains. If you like to stay downtown and don't want to spend a lot of money this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel for a couple nights”
Reviews.Author: LisaPunk01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the end of our week in the Pacific Northwest. There was nothing particularly wrong with this hotel but it could use a good update. The room was fine, nothing special. The bed was kind of hard an the pillows flat. The room was clean, no complaints there.The parking garage was a bit creepy and the elevator I think was the slowest elevator on the planet. The great thing about this hotel was that they have a rooftop deck where you can go up and look out at the skyline and water of Seattle. this was great. We went up for both a night viewing and a day viewing. You can see the Space Needle from the roof! Great picture taking area. There are deck chairs up there for relaxing. We also thought the location was great. We were about a mile away from Pike Place Market and an area with lots of restaurants so we thought that was a good walking distance. The "Seattle Center" area was even closer (maybe half mile or less???) so you can walk very easily to the Experience Music Project or Space Needle from this hotel. It also has a Starbucks directly attached to the hotel! The staff at both the hotel and the Starbucks were all extremely friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Randyl0898
Reviews.Content: Location is superb with access to the monorail to downtown, or the 13 bus to SPU . Great neighborhood restaurants. Breakfast for sure at the Mecca cafe. Rooms are adequate and the help at the front desk is world class. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Close to Key Arena”
Reviews.Author: gardenluvnnurse
Reviews.Content: This hotel was literally steps away from Key Arena. The staff were gracious and accommodating from the moment we arrived. Extremely clean rooms, great views from the roof top garden, comfy beds, and best of all, great area in Queen Anne neighborhood. It was so nice to just walk from our concert at Key Arena and into our cozy room. Great restaurants aplenty also within walking distance. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “excellent 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: libcon
Reviews.Content: This was a stopover for 3 couples en route to an Alaska cruise. Rooms were great, staff was knowledgeable and showed pride in the property. No bkfst but coffee shop opened off the lobby. Staff helped w/ transfer. Walking distance to space needle. We recommend this property for price, location, and comfort. btw: great rooftop view!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Phil2dogs
Reviews.Content: The Mediterranean Inn is an old but fully rejuvenated hotel wth a wonderfully convenient location. It is only 4 blocks from the Seattle City Center with the EMP, Space Needle, Monorail, et al. From the rooftop deck, you can view the Puget Sound on one side, and a panorama of the Seattle skyline on the other. The staff members are very friendly and knowledgeable about the city. The Inn is surrounded by a great variety of eating places, and there is a Safeway tucked-away on the same block. Additionally, the price was far better than nearly all of the other choices in this relatively expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Matched our needs.”
Reviews.Author: votefordems
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in mid-Sept 2011. Very nice tourist class hotel. Excellent location for our plans, as is located right at the Seattle Center and on major bus routes, and the rooms were still very quite. Service was very professional and helpful. Would definitely stay here again. Internet for the room was an extra $4 per day. Only reason did not give top rating was because of the window view and that there was no air conditioning in our room. We had a 3rd floor room on the south side, and could only see the building next to the hotel. And in mid SEPT, we did not need the air conditioning, but if stayed in summer, AC would probably be missed.

Reviews.Title: “No air-conditioning in room”
Reviews.Author: CATravelers123
Reviews.Content: Our room didn't have air-conditioning, just a ceiling fan, and a portable rotary fan. Facing the small courtyard, there is not really a breeze helping with the stuffiness. The room and bathroom were clean. The kitchenette is great for people who don't mind going around the corner to buy groceries at the supermarket, especially since the room comes without breakfast. The rooftop view is fantastic. Nothing beats a coffee from Starbucks (shares the building with the hotel), and then relaxing in a lounge chair on the rooftop to watch the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Fall weekend in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: top20view
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the quality of this hotel. The rooms were nicely remodeled and were very comfortable. The rooftop deck is fantastic and provides wonderful views of the downtown, waterfront and harbor. Sunsets and night are gorgeous. We walked to most waterfront and Seattle Center attractions, but we figured it was about 2 miles from the hotel to the south end of the waterfront attractions. It was very comfortable for us as active people, but otherwise might be a bit far. Downsides to the hotel are difficult first entry. There is no parking or pull out of any kind, so you kind of wander the local one-way streets until you can find a place to park so you can register. Then the parking beneath the hotel is great for small cars, but at $15 per day is a little pricey. A wonderful choice of restaurants are in very close walking distance. The staff accomodated all of our needs but were a little bit cold. Overall we thought the Mediterranean Inn was a wonderful value in the super hip neighborhood of Queen Ann, Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “An extremely overpriced a la carte property”
Reviews.Author: Kiteology
Reviews.Content: If you are not the one paying the bill, the Mediterranean Inn may be an acceptable accommodation. I say this based solely on the property's location. But to my standard, a small, pricy room without air-conditioning (ceiling fan only), that additionally charges heftily for parking, internet, and just about everything else (make sure you have your own sewing kit) is hardly worth anywhere near its price in comparison to other nearby options. While I was aware of the rather stiff parking charge in advance, I justified the high room price as being due to the property's location. At worst I figured that the money I saved not needing to rent a car for the two days of my stay would be a wash against the added cost. As it turned out, I could have actually saved a good deal of money renting my car early and staying somewhere else. I asked about internet access and was given a password, it was not until check-out that I learned the daily charge for this service. Thankfully I found that I still carried a needle and thread and was able to avoid another pricy expense (a 24-hour market, half a block away would have been more than worth the walk). The bottom line for me is that the Mediterranean Inn did not 'make the grade' when it came to the room I got for the money in the first place. To then continue to be 'nickel & dimed' for anything and everything beyond that, made for an expensive and humid (no A/C) experience.

Reviews.Title: “great location and awesome hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: MelodySPerry
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 3 nights while on a trip to seattle. the hotel is located in the heart of the seattle center( home of the space needle and key arena) and is literrally in walking distance to the attractions. it has a kitchenette which is really helpful and there is a safeway across the street so its easy to stock up on water, breakfast etc..i used the gym and its fairly small but it great for a quick workout while on vacation. the rooftop was definitely a +. great views of the city!!! we ended up taking the train from the airport to the hotel and it was super easy to get around. the monorail from downtown seattle is only about 4 blocks from the hotel. the hotel is also on a nice littlestrip with great restaurants(thai, greek, cajun, sushji, etc..) and there are pplenty of bars around also for nightlife. our favorite was Ozzies(a few blocks away) which had kareoke and a dj.. its a pretty happening spot. i would def stay here again.. great trip all around

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, charming and extremely comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Shmol
Reviews.Content: This hotel is such a cutie. It's located in the quiet residential Queen Anne Ave area and is within a walking distance to Seattle Centre and the waterfront. It's got the most amazing rooftop, from where you can see the city and the Seattle tower anytime of the day or night. The night views are quite spectacular, as well as sunsets and sunrises. So, if you stay there you must check out the rooftop. The rooms are decorated in the Mediterranean style and the bed is extremely comfortable. The service at the front desk is also great. Everyone we talked to was very positive and helpful. I heard that some rooms can be quiet noisy. So, if you are after peace and quiet ask for a room facing the courtyard instead of the street. Sure, you won't get any views but you are guaranteed to get the best night sleep. There is free internet in the lobby, but we were really surprised that this hotel doesn't offer free Wi-Fi in rooms. If it did I would give it even higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Seattle's Queen Anne”
Reviews.Author: Deanohh
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. It is not the most high-end, but the rooms are clean, the staff goes out of their way to be helpful, and the view from the roof top patio is unbelievable! There is a Safeway right across the street, and some amazing restaurants down the block. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel but no A/C means windows opened and it can get noisy”
Reviews.Author: TheAvatar_GR
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel is nice; it is clean; the staff are helpful and it is well located (about 5-10 minute walk from the space needle). The only thing to be aware of is that most rooms don't have AC which meant for us that we had to sleep with the windows opened. That fixed the weather issue but on one night in particular (e.g.: garbage collection early saturday morning). If you are a light sleeper, I would seriously consider sleeping elsewhere. Also, we didn't have much of a view and I got the feeling that they wouldn't transfer us because we were on expedia rate Overall, it was a positive experience for us and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: leeannch
Reviews.Content: This is a decently good hotel in a great neighborhood of Seattle. You'll be a mile walk to downtown, as well as upper Queen Anne. There is a Safeway one block away and a gourmet grocery store 3 blocks away, and many great restaurants around the hotel. You'll be greeted to a very nicely decorated lobby and a very friendly front desk staff. Rooms have more of a retro feel, but are comfortable. The hotel has a business center, exercise room (about 6 cardio machines as well as weights), laundry room, and rooftop deck with excellent views (there are chairs on the decks, but no tables for dining). The hotel offers WiFi, but with a $5/day charge (for around $8 you get WiFi, movie rentals, and bike rentals). There is also underground parking for $15/day. It's 3-level structure with tight spots, and we bottomed out our Prius when we pulled straight out (when we pulled to the left, no bottoming out). The only real drawback was that it was "toddler proofed." Our 20-month-old daughter could easily open the door to the lobby, even with the safety lock, so we had to block the door. The windows also have no secure screens (you could easliy pop through them) so we had to keep her off the sofa when the windows were open (and with no a/c, you need to keep them open in the evening to cool down the room). Nice touch: There is a mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker, and DVD player, and the room supplies free water, microwave popcorn, and Starbucks coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: Trueblue22
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, bed was super comfy. Rooftop deck has a beautiful view. Location was a little further from downtown & the harbor than we would have liked. Having a Starbucks in the lobby was great

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and good staff”
Reviews.Author: plstrobel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, staff was extremely helpful, the roof was a great place to sit and have a glass of wine and look out at the sound, but the rooms do not have air conditioning but have ceiling fans and there is a lot of street noise, but it wasn’t a big issue. Their is a Safeway right around to corner and rooms have a small icebox and microwave If you are planning on just running around Seattle downtown and the Space needle area I would not recommend on renting a car. The hotel has contacts with a car service and their price is a lot cheaper than a car service at the airport and the taxi can cost more than a car service. You can catch the monorail ($2) which is two blocks from the hotel and it goes downtown and the stop downtown is four blocks from Pike market and in the downtown buses are free. By the time you rent a car, pay $15 a day to park at hotel and then pay a whole lot for parking downtown it works out cheaper in not getting a car. You can catch a whale watching tour from pier 69 (which you can walk to) and that way you do not have to drive to Friday Harbor. Fun things to do: the underground tour, the ducks, the whale watching and of course Pike market. You can also get a city pass which is a bargain if you do the six attractions they have.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected, but not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: peanut1384
Reviews.Content: We read a lot of reviews about this place, and we were not too sure about staying there. Overall our family of four, kids (2) / (6) found this hotel a good stay. From our experience there were several positive and negative points. Pros: - Location was good. Walking distance to Science Center . Quick drive to Pike Place market, waterfront and easy access to highway to Seattle zoo. Lots of restaurants from different ethnic choices and from casual to fine dining within walking distance. - Room was relatively clean. - Rooftop view / patio was fantastic. - Surcharge for customer benefit program is OPTIONAL, there was free water, popcorn, coffee and tea provided in room. - The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. - Kitchenette was useful for breakfasts for the kids and snacking at night. (bring own paperplates and utensils) Cons: - Room had no AC (front desk said only some rooms have AC), but with opened window until late night and indoor fan, room was adequately ventilated. (be careful if you have young children with opened windows) - Street noise. Our room was on fourth floor facing one of the side streets, which you can hear traffic up to midnight. I am a light sleeper and noticed the garbage trucks at 6am. We closed windows at night and noise was tolerable. - Rooms are a bit small . For a 2 night stay for a family of four this hotel was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Bradinator
Reviews.Content: I'd read various reviews on this property and, as I was running out of options in summer-busy Seattle, decided to book it. I was prepared to 'put-up' with a few inadequacies. I should have not been so hesitant. It was a perfect mix for us. You're paying about half of what your pals downtown are paying. Sure, you don't have a doorman or a pool or a turn down service. But you do have friendly staff, very clean rooms, AC (not sure what people are going on about in this regard) and a host of excellent extras. The location is close to everything around Seattle Center including the Needle. You're a block off the main bus route to downtown and there's usually a taxi waiting right outside the front door. The shabby-chic lower Queen Anne Hill neighborhood is chock full of restaurants with a good ethnic mix, shops and supermarkets. The rooms are smallish, have minimalist kitchenettes (no flatware, bowls or cutlery), flatscreens and WIFI is available. I notice the cleanliness and my room was spotless. Except for the carpet. It had been cleaned but it showed the stains. Just wear sandals or sox. There's no onsite restaurant, but as mentioned elsewhere, the area is full of walk-to choices. Noticed: -business center -gym -spacious and comfortable sitting area in lobby -beautiful Spartan rooftop deck with Adirondack chairs to loaf in and soak up the view. Bring your own drinks. -Starbucks on site with backdoor (from the hotel lobby) entrance. They've got a great deal for the active: for a small extra fee you can access bikes/helmets and all the other amenities for one charge. An hour on the bikes would cover the daily cost. Can't wait to go back. '

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like it”
Reviews.Author: tortitabby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on past reviews and lack of last-minute choices. We were hopeful, but ended up disappointed. The service and quality was below average, the sheets were poor quality, thin and scratchy, and the late check in time of 4pm really put a wrench in our plans for the day. The location was not great as far as access to downtown, and the front desk staff was not very knowledgeable and helpful. When we asked if they would call us when the room is ready if before 4pm, they said no then can't do that because they get overwhelmed and busy. Other hotels I've stayed at had no problem doing this. I observed later that day the the front desk would stand around and chit-chat with each other. When we asked about buses, they were not sure which bus to direct us to take to get downtown. When I called down to ask for a cab, they said ok, but when I got down to the lobby 5 minutes later, they never called one. We were not impressed and won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and amazing service.”
Reviews.Author: talis1115
Reviews.Content: When i first arrived the service and greeting was so nice it made a very good first impression. I got to my room and at first glance i thought "this is a bit dodgy" however after staying in there the room had everything i needed and was very comfortable. There was no air conditioning but i was there in hot weather and at night you do not need air con at all. The hotel is in a great spot close to the monorail and lots of great restaurants. The bed was very comfy and my room had a great tv and also a dvd player which i thought was a nice touch, so i could watch my own movies. I would highly recommend this hotel because of the great location and fantastic service. It is also right across the road from a Safeway which was nice and handy. Having Starbucks in the bottom of the hotel was awesome as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: tunacat
Reviews.Content: Great location, convenient to so much in Seattle. Hotel needs an update. Extensive peeling in bathroom. Super noisy room at back of hotel - 1st floor. Right above the parking garage door and garbage cans. Beware - request to not be placed in this room for only this reason. Aside from outside noises in early hours of morning, it was quiet the rest of the time.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: HeloiseRxph
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days, and what a fantastic location!! Close to all public transportation, a great organic/wholefood market, as well as an upmarket supermarket. Lots of good restaurants in the neighbourhood... best of all was the front desk/concierge staff!! Great team, very helpful, super friendly!! room was basic but very clean. Will definitely stay here again! Oh yes, and the view from the top floor is amazing!!!! Great value for money

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a great location within walking distance of the Space Needle and downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: tonycmariner
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 100% non smoking and was ideal for our one night stay before joining our cruise ship. The location was great with good pubs and restaurants close by and in a good area of Seattle. A Starbucks is just off the lobby and there is a coffee maker in the room along with a microwave and fridge. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean. We will stay here again on our next vist to Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel close to the Space Needle”
Reviews.Author: JuJoGraham
Reviews.Content: Centrally placed hotel only a few blocks walk to the Space Needle & Monorail station. Friendly & helpful staff. Our room was on the top floor overlooking the Seattle skyline & Needle. The room was very comfortable & had a small kitchenette area. The room was spotlessly clean. Plenty of bars & restaurants within easy walking distance. We had breakfast in Starbucks which is accessed through the lobby of the hotel. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So convenient”
Reviews.Author: SummerfunVancouver
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely 2 night stay at this lovely little hotel. Not fancy, but all the necessities are taken care of. We were in Seattle with our 8 year old and walked just a couple of blocke to the Seattle Centre where time awas spent at the Children's museum, the Pacific Science Centre (a must do for those with kids), the space needle and so much more. It was a short ride on the monorail to downtown for shopping. Oh yeah, the hotel, great little place for those looking for a place to sleep, cause there is so much to do out there!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location in Lower Queen Ann”
Reviews.Author: Foodjunkie7599
Reviews.Content: This is a good quality hotel in the lower queen ann neighborhood which has several top quality restaurants and is close to the Seattle Center. There are good buss connections downtown and taxis are available. There is off street parking but it costs extra. Most everything else is extra too including the wifi. You can go down to the Starbucks in the lobby where it is free. The accommodations are comfortable but basic. There is no air conditioning in the room and a hot night is uncomfortable. Breakfast is Starbucks on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location and WHAT A VIEW”
Reviews.Author: AZ_Traveller55
Reviews.Content: This is a great location to eplore the city from and the view from the rooftop with a glass of wine can't be beat! The Queen Anne neighborhood has a wide variety restaurants, bars and a some music venues. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A little better than average”
Reviews.Author: Denver_93_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mediterranean Inn July 24 ---July 28. Pros: 1. They are no longer charging any additional fees. 2. They have computers in the lobby for customer use - and a business room with printer and additional computers -- very helpful and handy. 3. There are many good restaurants on Queen Anne Ave. within walking distance. 4. There is a grocery store and ATM machine within a block of the hotel. 5. The staff is helpful. 6. The view from the upstairs roof top is awesome. Cons: 1. The rooms are small and starting to show ware and tare. The carpet padding was lumped in our room in several spots. 2. The inside rooms have no view at all. The outside facing rooms have a view -- but also have traffic noise from Queen Anne Ave. Pick your choice. 3. You can't check in until 4pm. This was an issue for us. We arrived at the hotel at 12 noon and had to store our bags in a locked area until 4 pm. You have to check out at 12 noon so you don't make up the time when leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaTravelbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mediterranean Inn twice while visiting our son who lived a couple of blocks away. Very comfortable bed with a window seat that served as a bed for our daughter. There is a Starbucks in the lobby which was very convenient as well as a refrigerator in the room. There is a rooftop patio with spectacular views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “There's another hotel better, for sure!”
Reviews.Author: Canada12385
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location: Close to Seattle Centre (Key Arena, Space Needle, etc); within transit city bus routes that brings you to the downtown core business district and Pike Place Market. There's also quite a number of restaurants in the avenue where the hotel is located; including a Starbucks coffee shop in the same building. Cons: They charge you $ 4.99 USD per night for a Wi-Fi access (standard on almost every hotel in the world except here) and $ 15.00 USD per night for an underground parking (shouldn't that be free for all their guests??). Would stay in a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “A Sweet Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: jdetroit13
Reviews.Content: We stayed three days here while waiting for an Alaskan Cruise. This hotel was cheaper than others in the downtown area. The rooms aren't fancy or large, but perfectly adequate. We enjoyed having a mini-fridge and microwave too. We loved the Queen Anne neighborhood, just a short walk from Seattle Center park, the Space Needle, and the Monorail. There were some very good restaurants right down the street, a Safeway a short block away, and a Starbuck's connected to the hotel. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Best of all is the roof...a wonderful spot with benches to take in the view...the city in one direction and the ocean in another. Lovely! This place really worked for us and I wouldn't hesitate to visit again. If they had a breakfast included, they would've been rated 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Room, Spectacular Rooftop View"”
Reviews.Author: pugetsound70
Reviews.Content: Having grown up in Seattle, whenever I return each summer, I'm eager to maximize my love for the city. I don't want to spend a huge amount of time in my room, but I want it to provide a good frame for the place I am in. It's hard for chain hotels to provide this local frame. The Mediterranean Inn does this, largely because of its understated charm and its location. The room was super clean, and our king size bed was comfortable. Our room on the 9th floor had air-conditioning, which wasn't necessary, but it was nice to have the room temp perfectly regulated throughout the night. No complimentary breakfast here, or even a dining room. There is a very nice, large Starbucks with plenty of seating for breakfast, in the lobby of the hotel, and there are plenty of restaurants within a block of the hotel. You can use the hotels free bikes if you so desire (it'll take you 15 minutes or less to cycle to Pike Place Market), and they have a terrific workout room (or so my wife tells me). Parking is expensive ($15 a day), but we found street parking down on 2nd and Republican (a couple blocks away), which is free from 6pm-9am, and cheap two hour metered parking is plentiful after that. Some great restaurants are within a block (Toulouse Petite, Pesos, Pagliaci Pizza, Roti Indian, and Dick's!). Don't forget to take a glass of wine up to the rooftop to take in the view of the Emerald City. In short, this hotel provides a good frame for enjoying beautiful Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to check out downtown!”
Reviews.Author: 1luckylemon
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the location very much. While the rooms are very basic, they are extremely clean and comfortable. The microwave and mini fridge were useful reheating some great Greek leftovers as well. As far as the additional fee for dvd's, bike rental, etc. We opted out of it with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay when in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Jett46
Reviews.Content: The service was great the room was spotless and very comfortable, restaurants and supermarkets were a short distance away, including places of interest to visit e.g. Space Needle and Pike market was just a short distance away. We were en-route to our alaska cruise and the port was a short distance away, a shuttle service was also available from this hotel at a low cost of only $6.00 per person. Would definitely recommend this hotel for a pre cruise or vacation stay

Reviews.Title: “All around average”
Reviews.Author: Lizzylorax
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 days on our trip to Washington. The hotel was just average. Nothing too special about it. There was a Starbucks in the lobby which was nice. Internet and in room coffee and water was extra. Location was pretty good but we still drove to most of the things we wanted to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: holidayers007
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night so 24 hour check in was great. Staff were friendly and helpful. I had a package forward there several weeks before my stay, It was there waiting for me ready for my arrival. Room was clean and spacious. Great laundry facilities. Hotel had access to the Roof top giving a great view of the City. Location was great, walking distance to Space Needle and Mono Rail. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not like the pictures”
Reviews.Author: Bigwoody58
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 10 family members in multiple rooms for two nights before a cruise and one night after. I was disappointed. The good news is that it is fairly close to downtown, the Space Needle and the seaport. The bad news is that it ain't so great. The staff was civil but not very friendly. The elevators are painfully slow. The rooms have a bleak decor and from what I could tell not many have a view of anything. Our room faced a brick wall for both stays. The bathroom fixtures (tub,sink,toilet) seemed to be the cheapest money could buy. Our sink was cracked. I cut my hand on the sharp plastic rim of the "Breck" shampoo. The best views from the roof are obstructed by the stairwell shafts. I thought the beds were OK but the pillows were little flat things. Starbucks off the lobby was convenient. The room "amenities" package for an extra charge is confusing.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but beware of added fees!”
Reviews.Author: GoodeTimes
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Seattle at the Mediterranean Inn for two nights on our way back from a road trip down the Oregon Coast. We were greeted by a friendly front desk employee who moved us to a more quiet room on the fifth floor instead of the first floor room we were originally booked in, which was a pleasant surprise. The location was great for us, a short drive (or longer walk, approx 25 min) to Pike Place and the Underground tour, two of the things we were most excited for in Seattle. There were also two great restaurants for breakfast, The Mecca and the Toulouse Petite Kitchen & Lounge, and an amazing authentic Thai restaurant, Phuket, a block or two away on the same street as the hotel. One negative I had for this place was that they nickel and dime you for extra services, something I’ve never really experienced before without being informed by the hotel prior to our arrival. Be prepared to pay an extra $7 per night for these benefits. We just wanted the wifi so it was $5 a night, but I have never paid for wifi before and I wasn’t that impressed. Parking is also an extra $15 per night. At the same time this hotel was very nice and wasn’t as expensive as some in downtown Seattle. Our room was spacious, clean, updated and nicely decorated. I would highly recommend going to the rooftop patio for a drink and enjoying a sunset.

Reviews.Title: “NICKLE & TIME YOU”
Reviews.Author: SERVEPRO1
Reviews.Content: Nice neighborhood, small room, small unconfortable beds, loud at street level & above. $15 per night parking fee, $8 p.n sur-charge for internet and bottled water (NICKLE & DIME). Employees try to sneek additional charges in. Employees do not care about the deceptive pricing. The best for last; reserved a car thru the hotel employee who quoted a price of $70 + tip to pick up our party of four adults. The driver never arrived, found ride in strech limo for $45 + tip. Upon arriving at the hotel a prominetly displayed notice stated the charge from or to the airport was $45. Our party stayed at this hotel 3 days prior to taking a cruise, a 1 day after returning. We will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: nobodynos
Reviews.Content: very nice quiet hotel, will hold luggage early or until you leave. Rooftop is so great with fantastic views. They do charge $20 a night for air conditioning which is rarely needed in seattle. Buses go towards seattle downtown almost in front of the hotel and come back u taylor to republican. Cab to pier 69 was about $6. Ask for a view room if you specifically want a view. I got $107 on expedia. Starbucks next door. Dicks's burgers across the street. Safe neighborhood to walk in.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for walkers”
Reviews.Author: queen_sil
Reviews.Content: very clean and safe hotel. staff are helpful and accomodating. the area looks a bit rundown but it's very safe for walking around. terrific pub (Spectator) down the street and the most fab bistro ever (Toulouse Petite). dont miss the breakfast there. the location is perfect for budget travel with bus stops a few feet down the street. But it's only a half hour stroll to the Pike Street Market and about fifteen minutes more to Pioneer Square. This is going to be our go-to place in Seattle from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware, Not What we Expected--Price deception and NO AC??”
Reviews.Author: MBATHEMBA
Reviews.Content: Based on the many glowing reviews here, I booked our one-night stay at the Mediterranean, instead of a chain. The lobby area is impressive, the exterior pleasing, and the trendy lower Queen Anne neighborhood interesting (aka pricey). We arrived later after 9 hours of driving (8 pm) and found on a Wednesday night most of the recommended area restaurants/bars were packed: Toulouse Petit, 45 minute wait! When I booked the week before, I saw a $115 rate on expedia, called the hotel and asked for that rate. They "gave" it to me, claiming that was "a very good deal." I thought so too at the time. The room was very basic and simple, clean, fairly small. Did not find bed that comfy. We overlooked a parking lot from the 2nd floor. The "kitchenette" was a coffee pot/fridge/micro. Being nearly 10 pm when we settled in, we discover-- NO AIR CONDITIONING!!! Now, the temps were fine for open (screened) windows, but the area is NOISY not just with traffic, but with partiers. Not conducive for peaceful sleeping with drunken shouts through the night. This hotel should make it CLEAR there is no A/C!!! (we had stayed in a quiet coastal Oregon town the previous night, where an open window and waves crashing at night was welcome). It IS a 4-5 minute walk to the Space Needle and monorail to midtown; but we hoofed it back from Pike's Market, and the hill climb is intense! Had restaurants in the QA area not been so packed, it would have been pleasant to hang in that area for meals. Slow elevators; but do take advantage of the roof view which is a plus point. Bill time: this is where the ugly truth comes out: even though my email reservation confirmation "estimated room charges" was $134, with energy/utility surcharge, guest benefits program, sales tax, hotel tax (the latter 2 charged twice), parking ($15), and more sales tax on parking, our stay was charged $161.55! To add insult to injury, we requested a later check out due to a late afternoon flight and were denied this. The only small "accomodation" made was to allow us to keep our car in the garage (a very low-slung, cramped, spooky space btw). If we had stayed longer, maybe having bikes to use, work out room, coffee, popcorn and water bottles ("Guest Benefits Program"-a mandatory charge) would be worth it; but we were very underwhelmed and overcharged by an otherwise decent hotel. All I'd say is they need to be more up front with those "extra charges" and no A/C. We've never been charged so much on taxes and surcharges (nearly $50 over base price). Took the popcorn, water and coffee with us though, since we'd paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “We always stay there when in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: Gabrielle45
Reviews.Content: We love the Medit Inn! The staff are always responsive and friendly--five-star service at reasonable prices. We love the room (kitchenette, TV and DVD player, comfy bed, bathroom with tub). When we check in we get the kitchenette package with burners, pots/pan, tableware, etc. Kitchenette incudes microwave and coffee maker. Comp microwave popcorn & Starbucks coffee for brewing are there on arrive. I sometimes buy a toaster at neary Bartell's to round out the picture. On-site laundry, a small gym, and a meeting room are on the lobby level; the on-site Starbucks will appeal to some. Internet in your room is a reasonable price plus there is a guest-use computer near the lobby. The location in Queen Anne is great. A quick monorail or taxi down town plus lots of buses. Safeway, Metropolitan Market (upscale) and Bartell's satisfy basic supermarket and drug store needs in the neighborhood. A number of restaurants within 2 blocks (McHugh's Irish pub; 10 Mercer fine dining; Blue Water Taco Mexican; Racha's Thai; Signature Vietnamese phol Mecca Cafe diner) are great. For coffee/tea/snacks go to Uptown Coffee and Lladro's--nice places to sit and chat or read. Lladro's marionberry pie cannot be beat! Seattle Center (a 4-minute walk) has a food court, the monorial and the Experience Music Project as well as a lovely fountian and law for relaxing/picnics. Up the hill still in Queen Anne is the famed 5 Spot diner (upscale). And then there are the restaurants a short drive away (Flying Fish in South Lake Union, close to Whole Foods; Etta's, Oceanairre and Pike Place Market cafes downtown). In the summer be forewarned: only some rooms have air con. And the elevators run slow when the weather is hot.

Reviews.Title: “Advertised room rate is deceptive”
Reviews.Author: Lexvirgo
Reviews.Content: Nicely decorated hotel in a good location. However, they advertise a particular rate, and then inform you there is a "surcharge" for various amenities, like in room coffee. It is only 8 bucks, but come on. If it is mandatory, it is not a surcharge, it is part of the room rate and should be advertised as such. Further, the staff seemed to have the attitude that you are an idiot if you complain about the deception. On top of that, the toilet was broken, and while the desk clerk fixed it' at midnight, I would rather have been sleeping than dealing with that,especially at these ratesa. Give this one a miss, it is not as cheap as advertised, they treat you like an idiot, and there are much better places to stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “I would come back”
Reviews.Author: Collifu
Reviews.Content: It is not downtown downtown but there are lots of restaurants close by. And... Really affordable! With the Internet connection they offer a pack and you can rent a bike for free. Cool

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Queen Anne”
Reviews.Author: dlapof
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking through Hotels.com. We were in town for the U2 concert and wanted to be in Seattle. This was a very comfortable hotel right in Queen Anne which is a very nice neighborhood. It’s only blocks from the Seattle Center and the Key Arena. Lots of restaurants close by and Dicks the most famous fast food (fries and shakes) in Seattle is half a block away. We had requested an early check in (their normal is 4 PM) but it was 4 before we got our room, most likely due to the third party booking, as lots of folks that arrived after us got their rooms before us. The rooms weren’t huge but more then adequate and the staff was helpful. The only glitch was I called down for a cab in 15 minutes and when I got to the desk they said, “Oh they told us it would be a 45 minute wait”. The front desk never called me back or offered other alternatives except to go stand by the curb. I’m always amazed that hotels don’t plan ahead when they have so many occupants staying for a particular event (we ended up sharing a cab with another couple going to the concert). I think they wanted $8/night for internet but we never checked for sure as we didn’t need it.

Reviews.Title: “High-end hotel minutes from downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: AliveAtNight
Reviews.Content: This place was ideal for getting to the monorail and hitting up downtown Seattle. It's right next to the space needle and the Seattle Center. There are tons of cool little shops and restaurants around the area too. The rooms have kitchenettes and comfortable beds. The service was excellent. My only problem with the hotel was that they charged us a fee of $7/day to use the internet and a few other services we didn't know existed, like bike rentals and things like that. It would've been better if the fee was just included int he price and the extra services were just highlighted for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: tbaker26
Reviews.Content: Clean room, although small; comfortable bed; helpful front desk; love the neighborhood feel and nearby restaurants. Walked to Space Needle and Pike Market.

Reviews.Title: “Rip-off”
Reviews.Author: Marmched
Reviews.Content: This was our 7th or 8th stay at the hotel, which we'd previously enjoyed. But now there's a fee, called a "surcharge" when you check out - it includes paying for 2 tea bags, popcorn, roof access, exercise room, business center, bicycle use, and other items, whether you've used them or not. One of the front desk clerks got quite heated with an elderly couple, forcefully telling them the "surcharge is mandatory!" - they called it the "exit charge." Our bill also had an energy surcharge added, and they "upgraded" to a higher cost room than they had confirmed for us when we made our reservation online. We asked them to call a cab for us one night, which they had done before, but they called a limo service to take us to a restaurant, for 3 times the cost of a cab. We would not reserve with them or their sister hotels again - we would never recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but rooms look a little tired”
Reviews.Author: Junaido
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in April. Location is very convenient to downtown. Parking is $15 but I had no trouble finding free street parking for the night. The lobby is nicely done and staff were very helpful. The rooms looked a little tired, worn carpet, thin towels, old-looking bathroom flooring etc. Looked like an old apartment building that had been converted to a hotel. But it was OK for the night. Note that there is a "resort fee" of about $8 / night which is mandatory. Do check out the view from their rooftop. The Starbucks next door is very convenient for your morning caffeine fix.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to Seattle Centre”
Reviews.Author: McInMe
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for 2 nights during a 2-week road trip. The hotel was easy enough to find (once you find the right exit off the I5)! It's very easy walking distance to Seattle Centre, Key Arena, Music Museum and the monorail. It is quite far away from the market area, but the monorail is close and it will get you to the market area quite efficiently. Check-in was smooth enough and the front desk staff were well versed in the surrounding area and the tourist destinations. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Our room looked onto/into the neighbouring building and there was a loud exhaust in the alley below. Thankfully it shut off by the time we went to bed, then it was very quiet with zero street noise. The only on site eating establishment is the obligatory Seattle Starbucks. If you want a nightcap, best to bring your own! The hotel charges this mandatory service fee which allows you access to a bike rental, in room popcorn, bottled water and some other amenities that I don't recall. Parking is $15 per day. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay somwhere that in comfy and convenient to main attractions...this is your place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my son stayed here for our first familt vacation. I didn't want us to be somewhere that would be crawling with drunk kids on spring break and thought Seattle would be a good spot. Yes, my school took our spring break later than others. This hotel was a good price and was located about a couple blocks from the Space Needle. The trip to get to Seattle was long and it was refreshing to have a room that was comfortable and nice. The monorail was awesome and Pikes Place was amazing. When I come back to Seattle w/o my son, because there was definately some places I wanted to go that is not kid friendly, lol, I will definately be staying there. The staff was nice, courteous, and helpful when suggesting where and where NOT to go. Also I met a fellow Louisianaian who works there and he we talked about home, so I didn't feel too out of place there. An added plus was the workout I got trekking up the hills with my son's stroller : )

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfy hotel in nice part of town”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumNZ
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable hotel and I felt quite at home. The room was nice with the small kitchen and microwave as well. The room was well presented and clean, with good heating. They try hard to make you feel comfortable. There was the odd bit of noise when the floor above walked around but nothing which affected my stay. There is a supermarket right across the road which was handy to pick up a few drinks and nibbles. There is a bus to the centre right outside but only took 25 mins to walk to Pike Street Market and the city centre. Was a pleasant walk so didnt really use the bus. If you want a nice simple place to stay in Seattle, then choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but a bit loud”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie020
Reviews.Content: For the money, this hotel is good value. I found the rooms to be clean and the service was fast and friendly. The neighborhood only seemed fair, but that kept the price down. Ultimately, I would stay there again. Also, the Thai restaurant next door was pretty delicious and there was a Starbucks conveniently connected to the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: aharr66
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a sunny weekend in Seattle and found the hotel to be everything we needed. It is on a street with a ton of great restaurants and bars, there is a Starbucks in the lobby for convenient breakfast, and it's easy to get to most of Seattle from here. We parked on the street which was a hassle but cheaper than paying $15 per day at the hotel. Our king room was spacious and clean and the staff were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “5 star budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Steven6008
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Mediterranean Inn in Seattle and apart from the great rate I found through Expedia, this hotel offered service, cleanliness and attractive, comfortable rooms that far exceed it's so called ** 1/2 star rating.
