It is located just blocks from Seattle Center (Space Needle) and the monorail and has an array of restaurants to choose from near by. There is a Business Center in the lobby for internet access and the hotel is connected to a Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but desperately needs air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: MAT1234
Reviews.Content: We knew when we booked through expedia that most rooms in the hotel do not have A/C, but we didn't think this would be an issue in rainy Seattle. Well we were lucky enough to have extremely hot weather, making everywhere in this hotel with the exception of the lobby (which is air conditioned) completely and unbearably hot. The hotel itself was lovely and staff went above and beyond - even apologizing for the weather which I found hilarious. Location is not an issue thanks to Seattle's fantastic transit system.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Freoshocker
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Expedia after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. The location is a five minute walk from Seattle Centre where the monorail begins its trip to the city centre. The rooms were spacious and meticulously clean, the staff were very helpful. This hotel is value for money. There are numerous bars and restaurants that would suit most people in the immediate area, so finding somewhere to eat or drink was not difficult.

Reviews.Title: “I know where I'm staying when I return next year. Mediterranean Inn.”
Reviews.Author: Lil_Urban_Achiever
Reviews.Content: I selected Mediterranean Inn based on Alpine Ascents International, the guide service I was using to climb Mount Rainier. I needed to stay one night, check out the next day, and then return two days later. They were familiar with guests hoping to climb Mt. Rainier. I got there a little early and needed an area to repack my climbing gear for the gear review later that afternoon with AAI. They eagerly accomodated my my needs prior to check in. Later at check in they gave me a free upgrade. Upon my return from the climb I received another free upgrade to a corner room with air conditioning on the top floor (room 615). There was a big screen TV and the view was spectacular. There is a microwave in room which is great for nuking little personal pizzas purchased at nearby grocers. The refrigerator freezer is perfect for holding beer and Hagen Daas Ice cream (but you have to lay the ice cream on its side to fit it in the small freezer partition). The people there are fantastic. Always smiling and always eager to help. As mentioned earlier, next door are two grocery stores: Safeway and the awesome Metropolitan Market. One half block up is the Mecca Cafe where you would be remiss if you didn't stop in for the best breakfast in town. There is Starbucks connected to the lobby but I just used the Starbucks coffee packs in the in room coffee maker each morning. Late in the evening, be sure to take a couple of beers up to the rooftop and enjoy the incredible view after a day of walking the waterfront. This hotel is everything I look for in an out of town residence. It is clean, friendly, comfortable, and in a terrific part of town. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in many respects”
Reviews.Author: anglepoise
Reviews.Content: I'd give this hotel 5 stars if only my room would have had air conditioning and a better view. As it was, the ceiling fan and windows certainly helped, but since there were no screens on the windows, that let in the flying critters. My view was of my neighbors, so modesty and and worries of vulnerability, being a solo, youngish, blonde female traveler, made me keep the shades drawn, which meant being in a dark room 1/2 the time and I'm a bit claustrophobic. Otherwise, it was clean, everything was in working order and my bed was super comfy. The staff was wonderful. Oh and also they charge $5 a day if you want to use the internet in your room, so be forewarned. But the location was perfect; close to everything and on the bus line. I can't recommend the buses enough. They're clean, comfy, cheap and run constantly. I had no trouble getting around all parts of Seattle using their buses. And the rooftop deck offers up stunning views. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “ok stay”
Reviews.Author: Princesskain
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week on a leisure trip. Hotel was nice and clean. Parking garage was confusing. Front Desk said to look for the "key box" to gain access. After circling a few times, we found a flat "slot" on the wall in the alley, not a box at all. Room was clean and comfortable, but head board fell off the wall on the first night after I sat up against it. Was not mounted, was positioned on a 1" wide x 4ft long board, and the board was just screwed in the wall with no anchors. A little unsafe. The views from the roof top were beautiful. Could see the Space Needle from our window. Bathrooms were big and clean, but no ventilation/fan. Hotel is in a great neighborhood, across the street from Safeway. Walking distance to Space Needle. Short drive to Pikes Market & waterfront. If you enjoy thai food, I highly recommend Phuket located just 1/2 block away. Their chicken in peanut sauce was the best I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value/Location”
Reviews.Author: Across
Reviews.Content: Stayed prior to Alaska cruise and would definitely stay here again. Comfortable, clean room and quiet when we were there. Very nice staff and they let us check-in on arrival at 2:00 PM. Roof top terrace is not fancy, but superb view of Sound, Space Needle and downtown skyline. Only three blocks over to waterfront and then couple blocks down to SAM's Olympic Sculpture Garden and then a few more blocks down to the Aquarium and Pike Place. Space Needle also only a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: topfan
Reviews.Content: This was the beginning of a two-week trip throughout WA / OR, and wasn't too bad for starters. Our rooms were basic and clean, just what we were hoping for. The location was quite good, with the space needle an easy ten minute walk, and many restaurants of several ethnicities within one square block. Check in was easy and the staff was very helpful. The Mediterranean has a great view from the rooftop deck, which is where we had breakfast one morning and enjoyed the views of the Sound. However, if you're sensitive to ambient noise this isn't the place for you. The walls are a bit thin, but worse is there is no air conditioning, making it necessary to open windows for ventilation, allowing city noise to fill the room. On top of that we had an apparently heavily drugged - or drunk - homeless person sleeping on the street across from our side of the building, yelling obscenities throughout the night. I know for a fact I was not the only person to go to the desk and complain about it, but he was still there in the morning. In their defense, the hotel staff checked their records and said that someone from the desk called the police, but nonetheless he was still there in the morning. As a basic, relatively inexpensive city hotel this is an adequate facility. I personally enjoyed the neighborhood (for the most part), but it's not everyone's cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Service, Location and the Rooftop deck!”
Reviews.Author: mtnlvr10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two different times during a recent trip. Found the rooms kept very clean (SOOO important). Staff was exceptionally helpful, especially in handling a special request. Location is excellent with access to Seattle Center by foot and public transportation a few doors away. Also, is across the street from Safeway and 2 blocks from Metropolitan Market..like Whole Foods. Many, many good restaurants easy walking distance. NO need for a car here. Starbucks in-house. Only wished for a few kitchen ammenities were included like basic cutlery and settings. While there is a microwave, sink, small fridge, coffeemaker, 2 mugs and 2 glasses, that's it. Weekend nights can be noisy outside on the street, but not ongoing. The rooftop deck is super for byo cocktails during sunset. Overall, not fancy, but comfy. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, no air conditioning!”
Reviews.Author: safronia2
Reviews.Content: This place has no air conditioning in the rooms. Our room was supposed to have a view...which appeared to be a brick wall about ten feet from the window. The place is older and needs updating. However, the staff was very polite and helped us anyway they could. Great staff! The place was clean and the common areas were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tesha T
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Seattle Center, Space Needle, Music Experience, Key Arena. On bus line and short walk to Monorail ($4.00 round trip) which drops off in downtown Seattle ( very short ride) at the Westlake Center Mall. Hotel has no AC, which means sleeping with the windows open, and that was somewhat noisy at night. Food Tips: For Breakfast - Peso's Kitchen and Lounge, less than 2 blocks away. They have a breakfast happy hour from 9:00 - 11:00 am. All breakfast entree's are $6.00, they have a hugh selection, and it was delicious. We had the Spicey Habanero Sausage Gravy over Fluffy Buttermilk Biscuits and the Cream Cheese and Strawberry Stuffed French Toast, sooo good! www.pesoskitchen.com Also Umi Sake House on First Ave has a great 4:00 - 6:00 pm happy hour that includes sushi at great prices! This place gets crowded so get there early. www.umisakehouse.com

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Seattle hotel!”
Reviews.Author: frkbrown
Reviews.Content: Seattle is my favorite city and the Med Inn is my favorite hotel in Seattle. The rates are very reasonable and the rooms are comfortable and clean. If you're lucky you might even get a decent view! (The interior room views are not all that great, but everything else makes up for it.) The hotel is close to Seattle Center and within (for me anyway) walking distance to Pike Place Market and Pioneer Square. If you know where to go, there are plenty of good places to dine. I can't wait until I have the opportunity to visit Seattle again. I'll definitely stay at the Med Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ladysteele75
Reviews.Content: Even though I live in Seattle, I frequently stay in the Mediterranean Inn when I have an ELKS function since it is only 2 blocks away. The staff have been great to us Elks, even offering us discounts for groups. I highly reccomend this hotel to everyone especially if you are traveling to/from the cruise ships. I know that parking is always an issue in Seattle, but now there is a sign posted in front of the hotel. There is a parking lot (pay) behind the hotel and you might be better off to pay for an hour instead of getting a ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: seyyah_2009
Reviews.Content: Mediterranean Inn is a beautiful hotel with excellent value. The rooms are large and comfortable and we got a room with a lake view even though we didn't ask for it. The rates were much more reasonable than any other hotel of this level of quality. The hotel is walking distance (2 min.) to Seattle Center and Space Needle, from where you can take the Monorail ($2 per person) for a 5-10 min ride to downtown. There are several restaurants and cafe's around the hotel as well. We really enjoyed our stay at the Mediterranean Inn and we recommend it to any sightseers visiting Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good price and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Johngil
Reviews.Content: An average hotel. A little dated. Staff was freindly. Parking was extra but worth it(good security). Safeway across street, so you can safe when you use the kicthenette.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel & friendly staff, great location & price”
Reviews.Author: traveling_from_pdx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here February 20-22 - booked on hotels.com, when my boyfriend called to ask about a room with a view, they said we'd been booked into a low floor room, but for ten dollars a night could upgrade to a room with a water view. They put us on the 6th floor, and we had an incredible view from our room. We didn't find the rooms to be too small at all, as some others have mentioned, perfect, as hanging out in the room was not why we came to see Seattle. At any rate, the staff was super friendly, the room had coffeemakers, complimentary coffee and water bottles... really outstanding for the price. And the rooftop deck offers a truly terrific view of the city. I would stay here again without question, and would just call them directly next time to ask for the room with the view. The only, only small bummer was that a fire alarm went off in the hotel around 8 am Sunday morning, which was not a fun way to wake up - but the good news is, that is one loud fire alarm :) ... it was a false alarm, but we just headed up the street to grab coffee while we waited to get back into our room. Also, it would be nice if the wi-fi in the rooms was free, but hey, you can't have everything! All in all, a great hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, 5 blocks from the space needle”
Reviews.Author: dimapsi
Reviews.Content: My experience was very good. I've stayed for 2 nights only. Check in time is a little inconvenient if you arrive early (4pm) , but you can leave your baggage there and go out visit Seattle Downtown. Breakfast is not included but there is a starbucks that you can enter just from inside the hotel. Great business center, open 24hrs, to use free internet or print.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dempsey_Family08
Reviews.Content: The first room we were given had no bed (we had a good laugh about it at reception, and they gave us an upgrade for the inconvienience), the hotel was very nice. It was a long way from the centre of Seattle, but the buses were great and very close. Supermarket around the corner was handy, we had a kettle, microwave and a small fridge. No breakfast, but plenty of coffee shops around! Nice view from the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, friendly hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: aurorio
Reviews.Content: Want to go to Seattle but don't want to spend a lot of money on a hotel? The Mediterranean Inn is a great deal. I didn't want to spend a fortune on a hotel, but I didn't want to stay in a dump, either. I found the Mediterranean on Expedia, where I got a GREAT deal. I've read that if you deal directly with the hotel, they will match anything you find online. I paid less than $100 a night. The staff is very friendly, the hotel is attractive, and the rooms are comfortable. Having a kitchenette is a great feature and there is a nice Safeway right around the corner, so you can stock up on groceries. The hotel is right on several bus routes, so you can get downtown in mere minutes. You can also walk about two blocks to the Space Needle and Monorail, which is another great, quick way to get downtown. The neighborhood is lower Queen Anne and very pleasant. As a solo traveler, I never felt uncomfortable walking after dark in the vicinity of the hotel. The Mediterranean is not fancy, but it is definitely comfortable and pleasant. I would certainly stay here again. It's a great base for seeing the various sights of Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: floridajax99
Reviews.Content: This is in a nice location but just has the basic needs. The reviews led me to believe this was an exceptional hotel. This is a good value and a good location. The rooms are not well appointed and the staff was not overly helpful. A good value yes. Top notch hotel it is not.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay You Can have in this Great City”
Reviews.Author: fmgallant
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to spend time with your loved one. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and if you rent a car they have a under ground garage. The hotel is located in the hub of Seattle's Queen Ann area with easy access to down town using the mono-rail system and the must visit Pike's Place market. Within easy walking distance of the Space Needle and some great eateries like Thai food located on Mercer and 1st Ave rated as one of the top fifty in the United States, and Peco's a short one block from the hotel. Order the Dungeness crab omelet and a 'El Diablo Mary at Peco's. Enjoy your stay, and by the way this is the first time I have taken the time to write a review. Frank and Debra Gallant

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: whenissummer
Reviews.Content: I booked because of the reviews on Tripadvisor and it was better than I expected. Great price (parking not included =$15 a night), great location (a short walk to Key Arena), clean and well managed. Some people might want a more central location, but we found the neighborhood perfect for a quiet stay. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Seattle Gem”
Reviews.Author: bigbirdwashington
Reviews.Content: Whether you are a tourist or a local, this hotel is a great find. The location couldn't be better for exploring the Queen Anne neighborhood, attending an event at Seattle Center or Key Arena, or experiencing Seattle itself. The hotel itself is small and prices are very reasonable (book with the hotel directly, as they will meet or beat what's listed on hotels.com or other booking sites). We paid $109 per night for a king room on the top floor, which is very reasonable for downtown Seattle. The hotel also offers weekly and monthly rates for those needing extended stays. The hotel is decorated simply, is extremely clean, and very festive for the holidays. Parking is an extra $15/day (unlimited in and out privileges) in a secure underground garage. The rooms have a kitchenette with a microwave, 'fridge, and a sink. The beds are comfy, even if the decorating scheme is not very earth-shattering. The bathrooms are neat, clean and have a shower/tub combo and adequate counter/sink space. The hotel is on several major bus routes to both the top of Queen Anne and to the center of downtown. Plus, there are several grocery stores (Safeway and Metropolitan Market), pubs, restaurants, and shops in the immediate vicinity. The front desk personnel were always friendly and willing to provide information, bus schedules, etc. I would highly recommend this hotel for those new to Seattle or those who just want an inexpensive weekend break in the city.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn is Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Avalancheman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mediterranean Inn for three nights in October and were very pleased with this hotel. Beautiful views, excellent location, clean room - with a nicely equiped kitchenette - and a Starbucks in the lobby. Best buy in the Seattle area if you are looking for a comfortable place to stay and don't need a pool, restaurants, or conveniance store on location - it's all within a block of the place anyway. We did get a corner room - better views, but the stairway cut into the size of our room considerably. We still had plenty of room and with a view, but if it is more than two people or with kids it would be a tight fit. Able to walk to everything - Space Needle, mono-rail, water front, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: scq7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early Sep 2008 and found the hotel to be nice. It is situated in a convenient location within walking distance of many areas of interest to visitors. Our room was clean and had all the amentities you'd expect. The roof top viewing area is great!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location , clean and pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: Rugbyskippy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights the first week of October. The room was very clean and a reasonable size. We especially liked the free internet usage in the lobby and found all the staff on the reception desk to be very friendly and helpful.The hotel is very handy for the Space Needle area and Monorail and has many bus stops just outside with frequent buses to many destinations. Also just a few minutes walk away there are plenty of restaurants and bars, especially T S McHugh's with a good selection of beers and meals. With Starbucks part of the hotel building, breakfast was made easy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: jess_andy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights. The room was nice and bigger than I expected. There is a Starbucks connected to the lobby which made it easy to grab a hot chocolate in the morning. There was a good sushi restaurant right across the street and a few other restaurants very close. We were able to walk to the Space Needle in 10 minutes or less and also walked to Pike Place and the Seattle Aquarium one day (long walk but definately feasible if you're up for it). We would stay here again and think the price is right- the only thing I missed was a hot tub!

Reviews.Title: “Nice middle class hotel: Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: beelzebot23
Reviews.Content: We were in the Mediterranean Inn for one night before getting a car rental to drive to San Francisco. We liked the hotel and were pleased with our choice. The location is quite good, it is reasonably close (max. 10 Minutes walk) to the Monorail station, which needs another 2 minutes to go to the city centre. A bus stop is on the same block. The rooms were very clean, modern, well-equipped and quite big. Computer terminals and a business centre are available. There was no breakfast, but a Starbucks in the same building and about 5 Restaurants within 100 meters. We can especially recommend Sam's Sushi.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: purplxstar
Reviews.Content: We spent a day/night in Seattle. Ended up booking with this hotel because of price and location. About 10-15 minute walking distance to the Monorail. We also felt pretty safe walking back from the Monorail at around 8 or 9pm. It has a gated parking garage under the building, but you only get access after you check in. It is conveniently located across from a major grocery store (Safeway... I think). And we also found a Thai restaurant just down the street called Phuket that we absolutely loved!! The room itself was pretty standard, with no AC but a ceiling fan. During our stay in September, we left the window slightly open and was fine throughout the night. Overall we were pretty satisfied with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect short stay”
Reviews.Author: mimiNaperville_IL
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, we decided to try it. Excellent choice for a first visit to Seattle! Front desk staff were all very helpful, the hotel was spotless, & pretty conveniently located to almost everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: shauna512
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Seattle and we were so impressed with the Mediterranean Inn that I wanted to share. STAFF: The staff was awesome. Very friendly and helpful. We asked for directions and dinner suggestions several times and they went out of their way to give us help, including giving us maps and printing out directions. We asked to have a good view in our room and they upgraded us at no charge as well. HOTEL This hotel was decorated well (kind of trendy looking on outside) and was cozy. Nothing too fancy but very nice. They even have a starbucks (yes, imagine that in Seattle) that connects in the Lobby. If you can't stand heat, be sure and ask about their Air Conditioned rooms (which are a little more expensive). Our first 2 nights were in a room without AC and the temp. was fine with the ceiling fan. LOCATION The location was great. A few blocks (walking distance even with our 3 year old in a stroller) from the Space Needle. There are lots of nice restaurants nearby and even a grocery store. The roof top view is very nice also.. we got some great photographs. PARKING We paid $15/day for their parking garage that was under the building. Made it really easy to get the luggage up.

Reviews.Title: “My family's favorite”
Reviews.Author: foodie66
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Mediterranean Inn at least 5 or 6 times in the last few years and have never had a bad experience. The location is great, especially if you have kids, as it's close to the Seattle Centre (Science museum, children's museum, space needle) and you can take the monorail downtown and to Pike Place Market. The area is also great for walking around -- there are good restaurants, grocery stores, a used book store. The last time we stayed here (Aug 2008) I booked a king sized bed and found it very comfortable -- on previous trips we've had a queen bed that was a bit too small for us. Also, you can request a room with a window seat made into a bed if you're traveling with a small child (probably not good for those younger than 3 as it's fairly high off the ground). My 6 year old loves it. The one down-side is that the windows aren't the best and let a good deal of street noise in but I can't say that it's bothered us much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find”
Reviews.Author: stubby9417
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Positives: Nice clean rooms with a comfortable feel Close to great places to eat like Dicks, Mecca Cafe 1 block away from Seattle Center (Space needle, EMP) Good staff Negatives: No breakfast! 15 dollars for parking! (but you can look for street parking, which isn't too hard) All in all, we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: marmite1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and it was the perfect location to explore Seattle. We walked to all the main attractions, Space Needle, Experience Music Project, Pike Place Market etc. The location is also close to lots of smaller shops and eateries. The view from the roof terrace was fantastic, take your breakfast up there and enjoy! The room was spacious with great coffee.

Reviews.Title: “nice time”
Reviews.Author: frane12
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in Queen Anne close to Seattle Center (Space Needle, EMP, Monorail, Key Arena). The rooms are clean and comfortable with kitchenettes. There is NO A/C - do not be surprised by this! We went in late July and were fine with the ceiling fan and window, but if you must have a/c, don't book here! There is a cool rooftop deck with good views of the city and the water. The staff was friendly and helpful at all times. I have to disagree with those who say the hotel is on a "very busy street". I just didn't see that. It is a one-way main road, but we did not see a high volume of cars nor people in this area at all. I thought it was a nice area and there are several restaurants you can walk to. We had a lovely time here - I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Geat stay at the Mediterrean”
Reviews.Author: WIAnn
Reviews.Content: The Mediterrean is located close to Seattle Center and the Space Needle. It is only rated a 2star. It must be because there is no AC or restaurant attached. However, there is an attached Starbucks and the coffee aroma is great, esp in the AM. There is a nice roof top garden...Starbucks and a view!! What could be better. This was a great moderately priced hotel, that deserves a better rating. Clean rooms, efficient staff, prompt elevators. Nice decor, charming lobby and exterior. Stay there if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: jnovotny
Reviews.Content: I stayed here due to the mostly very good reviews I found online. However after 2 nights here, I received over 10 bed bug bites, 2 on each of my hands, 4 on my back and 5 more on my arms! I can't believe I paid over $130 for this experience and it's taking over a week for the bites to go away. I called and complained and am hoping they have done something about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: MaikoG
Reviews.Content: After searching for a hostel or reasonable hotel in Seattle without much luck, I came across the Mediterranean Inn for $114 plus taxes a night. It turned out to be almost too good to be true. The hotel is in a great location, a short walk to Key Arena and the Space Needle, and only a block away from a bus stop where for $1.75 buses take just ten minutes to get you downtown to the major tourist attractions and run frequently, arriving every 15 minutes or so. Alternatively, if you want to take a taxi downtown it costs approximately $10 including tip. From the time I made my reservation to the time we checked out, the hotel staff were always pleasant and helpful. The room itself was very clean and comes equipped with a kitchenette, two complimentary bottles of water, coffee/tea and popcorn. There is a Safeway supermarket on the opposite block if you want to buy groceries. Also, you can either work out in the hotel gym or if you are a member of 24 Hour Fitness, it is located just wo blocks away. There is a great restaurant that serves breakfast happy hours two blocks away called Peso's, as well as lots of other restaurants nearby. There is also a Starbucks attached to the hotel if you need a coffee fix. Finally, the hotel rooftop is open from early morning until late at night and you can relax and enjoy breakfast in the mornings up there or watch the sunset over the city skyline with a glass of wine in the evenings. I am reluctant to write a review because I hope the Mediterranean Inn remains a well kept secret!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: Fishking
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. Room was very comfortable with a cool window seat with a bit of a view and convenient parking under the hotel with elevators for $15. It is located in great neighborhood, near Seattle Center and the Space Needle within an interesting walk to downtown and Pikes Market but with buses nearby. The great thing about the area is it has lots of local people and their restaurants, coffee shops and bars so you are not just stuck with tourists and traveling businessmen. Try The Crow, great neighborhood Bistro nice bar their signature dish is the chicken but the fish was great too (823 5th Ave N).

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: craigh
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Seattle for the first time, and am glad I chose the Mediterranean Inn as my base. The room was pleasant, clean and spacious. I appreciated the kitchenette with microwave, kettle and coffee-maker - as well as the free internet terminals in the lobby. The hotel has an on-site Starbucks, and has several restaurants and cafes nearby. It is only a few minutes walk away from the Space Needle and the monorail. I would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: troylevy
Reviews.Content: Perfect room for the price. Perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “I like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlaskaGambler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Med again as I did in December. Met with the same experience. Friendly staff and nice room. They do not have A/C in all rooms so if that is important, check to see if you can book one of those rooms in the summer. They have a Starbucks in the lobbly. The hotel is very convenient to Seattle Center and Key Arena and the Queen Anne area of Seattle. I hope to stay there again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “clean, smart, friendly”
Reviews.Author: SJCCleveland_England
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and smart and the staff were very friendly and helpful. It offered free internet and there is a Starbucks on the bottom floor, great for quick breakfast. Although it isn't in the downtown area it is very accessible with the bus stop just up the road.

Reviews.Title: “Basic ameneties, yet a travlers haven”
Reviews.Author: AdventurerAnth
Reviews.Content: I originally booked the Mediterranean because it was the highest starred hotel for the cheapest price at Hotels.com, but when I arrived it rapidly grew on me. Not only did it have an in-room kitchenette (which hadn't been mentioned anywhere in their brochures), but there was also a Safeway right across the street, which meant a traveler could quite comfortably eat inexpensively and heartily without having to dine in restaurants (although the hotel does in face *lack* a restaurant. The best one can do is visit the adjoining starbucks for an impromptu out-of-pocket continental breakfast). Even when I had to check out early on June 2nd, the staff was very helpful when I needed to contend with the stubborn and somewhat clueless customer service reps at Hotels.com, even going so far as talking with Hotels.com on the phone for me. The manager could have been more helpful rather than insisting it wasn't their problem (with hotels.com insisting it *was*), but the staff more than made up for the double-talk I endured. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: snoopyjoanne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mediterranean Inn in mid-May for 4 nights for an anniversary. We were very pleased with it. After reading all the reviews, we knew what to expect - nothing fancy, but clean, safe and in a great location. We were there during that heat wave, and temps were reaching the 80s, but we were out most of the day seeing the sights, so had no need to the A/C. Our room only had a ceiling fan, which was sufficient enough while we were sleeping. The only thing was when we slept with the windows open for some air circuation, we could hear our neighbors across the courtyard chatting. Nothing very loud at all and I just put in some ear plugs. Perhaps if we had gotten a room facing the other way, we would have been faced with street noise too. The front desk staff was helpful, one guy told us to get breakfast at the Mecca Cafe right down the street in Queen Anne - yum! We also liked how the business center offered free printing - great for planning out bus trips and printing out routes. We did plenting of busing and walking during our trip to Seattle. The hotel is conveniently located along major buslines going downtown and also lines to Ballard, Green lake, etc. Loved that it is walking distance to the Seattle center - we walked there every day. The bathroom looked like it had new fixtures and was very clean. I didn't mind that it was basic, cleanliness is the most important thing to me; no mold or anything to be found in the bathroom. We loved having the kitchennette w/ fridge and microwave and coffeepot. Nice to have Starbucks downstairs and Safeway across the street as well. Nice little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: mchar74
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. It was clean and the rooms were spacious, especially the bathroom. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had arrived at the hotel around 10:30am and wanted to just drop our luggage off and explore the rest of Seattle. But with a little luck, we were told our room would be available in half an hour. There are computers in the lobby with internet connection. Connecting to the lobby is a Starbucks, so getting coffee every morning was easy, although they do provide coffee and a coffee maker in your room, along with a sink, mini refrigerator and microwave. There is a Safeway right across the street, which made things very convenient to buy microwavable dinners and having an affordable meal. Getting to the downtown area was not difficult, as the Seattle Center is about two blocks away and if you take the monorail, it takes you into the downtown area. I would recommend anyone who wants an affordable trip to Seattle, to check out this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, very convenient”
Reviews.Author: rock2fox
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. Nothing bad, and not too much that sets this hotel apart in a good way either. There is no A/C in the rooms, I guess people used to that will think it odd that I mention it (but I am from Texas, so we like our air cold). The staff was friendly and the property seemed to be well maintained and convenient to most things in the downtown Seattle area.

Reviews.Title: “Great resonably priced hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: JulieandFred
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during the first week of March. We needed to be in Seattle to handle some family matters, so this was an unexpected getaway. For the price, it was very clean, the kitchenette was a great amenity (fridge, sink, coffee maker), and close to attractions. We felt that the beds could use some updating. On both of the double beds, there was an indentation in the middle. So that made it a bit uncomfortable for sleeping. Otherwise, we would definitely stay here again on a return trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “The Med Inn is a decent stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: PhillyDweller
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is NOT in downtown Seattle. It's in the Lower Queen Anne Hill section of the city. It's about two blocks from Seattle Center, featuring the iconic Space Needle, but also with many other museums and attractions plus the Key Arena. This makes the Mediterranean Inn ideally located for people looking for a relaxing stay in Seattle or families with children. Downtown is easily accessed by the city's wonderful public transportation system or, if you're able, a good healthy walk. The hotel itself is very reasonably priced, but we're talking no-frills here. Just a basic clean room. The staff was friendly and helpful. The neighborhood features many varied restaurants for every taste imaginable. From burgers to Indian to Thai, Lower Queen Anne has it all. And if you're still hungry, there's a Safeway supermarker across the street. Very handy. Other hotel features are a gym (small), TWO computers with internet in the common area, a laundry, and a Starbucks (imagine that) in the hotel. The bad news is the elevators are s l o w . And if you get a room facing the Space Needle, you might have to deal with some street noise at night. And the best view of Seattle is a short (but steep) walk away at Kerry Park. Try to get there around sunset for postcard quality views.

Reviews.Title: “Basics with a great roof top view”
Reviews.Author: astooks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. It was your basic hotel room, nothing too fancy. Nice amenities such as the Starbucks adjacent to the lobby downstairs as well as a great roof top view. Views of the bay, downtown, and Queen Anne Hill. Good price for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: flyeveryday
Reviews.Content: I live in Seattle and having sold my home at the end of Jan. and leaving for Europe for an extended period of time starting April 1st I chose the Mediterranean Inn to spend the remaining two months. It was the best choice I could have made the staff is excellent friendly and professional. The Inn is modern and very clean offering free internet in the lobby or internet in your room for forty dollars a month. They have a clean and modern laundry room for the guest to use as well as an exercise room. The Inn's location is ideal with good restaurants, fast food, two major food stores a movie theather and the Seattle Center/Space Needle within a five minute walk. There is also two metro bus stops within a half of a block from the front door that will take you to any point in Seattle within minutes. The Inn has a fantastic roof deck that offers some of the best views of the downtown with such landmarks as the Space Needle, the waterfront and both west/east the mountain ranges. I enjoyed the spacious room that seemed very comfortable with the largest bathroom I have seen in a hotel or Inn. The house cleaning staff is very good I never had a need to ask for anything. It was a great stay at a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cdnmountaingirl
Reviews.Content: This was a very central and easy-to-find gem in downtown Seattle. Some of the highlights include: clean, secure underground parking ($15 or so), complementary computers in the lobby for internet access, free wireless in the lobby, nice room, helpful and pleasant staff, 15 minute walk to shopping downtown. I would recommend this place; overall very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value, Very Helpful Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: teapot9
Reviews.Content: Great location, great value. Good view of space needle on 6th floor. Front desk staff profoundly helpful when I needed to cut my trip short due to a family member's illness. Room not all that special. Bed ok. Again, fabulous location with many excellent restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: jams33
Reviews.Content: We really loved everything about this hotel. It was in a supreme location and the room was in excellent shape. It was large and clean and had a few amenities (vcr, fridge). We had a low floor room so we couldn't see the Space Needle but we ventured up to the roof to get a beautiful view of the whole city. The surrounding area is full of shops, restaurants and attractions. It is only a 5 minute walk to Seattle Center and the museums, Space Needle and Experience Music Project. And downtown is just a short drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price, security, amenities.”
Reviews.Author: kbp619
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, the place looks to have been recently remodeled. The staff was friendly, security quite ample (CCTV and keycard elevators). All rooms include fridge (with bottled water), microwave (with popcorn), coffeemaker (with coffee), and TV. Beds were okay, pillows could've been better. Dick's burgers and Safeway groceries directly across the street. Several other restaurants and bars within 2-3 blocks. We paid $95+tax for this room and it was so much better than the Homewood Suites on Western Ave. Also 2 blocks from Seattle Center, Spaceneedle, monorail, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good view”
Reviews.Author: mgsilvis
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. The location is supreme. I don't think that we got enough bang for our buck. Everything was clean and we paid to get upgraded to the sixth floor. I don't see why we had to pay, we had already paid an extra $30 to be able to use their underground parking. I used the gym and it was helpful. There weren't that many machines, just the basics. There were bottles of water and fruit available which was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Blakey_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in Nov 07. First night was a bit rough, we had asked for a room with a view of the Space needle, which is exactly what we got. It was a nice room on the sixth (top) floor, room 632. However, the hotel has a bathroom extraction system that is always on, as opposed to having a system that has a fan on a timer in each individual room. Unfortunately the motor/unit for this entire system appears to be directly above this room, mounted on the roof. As a result we found it almost impossible to sleep! This issue was resolved the next day with a transfer to another room on the fifth floor on the other side of the hotel, sadly minus the view of the needle but they did give us a discount for the inconvienience, problem solved! The hotel is lovely, nice and clean, very helpful staff and we would certainly stay here again as well as recommend it to others! The real benefit of this hotel is the fantastic location!!! There are plenty of shops/supermarkets for any of your food/beer requirements (each room has its own little kitchenette/bar!) and tons of places to eat, drink, breakfast etc etc. The hotel is also directly next to the Seattle Centre (Key Arena, Space Needle, museum's, theatre etc) and also on a main bus route to get directly into downtown Seattle if you don't fancy the walk. Good choice of hotel!! Good choice of city to stay in, Seattle was a great, safe place to vacation in, lots to do!!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for a Good price”
Reviews.Author: Chook7
Reviews.Content: We walked in off the street & were still given a special rate for staying 2 nights. Great location, clean room. A short walk down the road to Peso's where we had scrummy food. Close to space needle & monorail. Love the viewing deck on the roof overlooking Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cnerm
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to local attractions like the Space Needle and Science Museum. The hotel is also a block away from a great Safeway's Supermarket and a number of food outlets. The room was clean, with a firm bed and one chair near a desk. This is great if you were single but as a couple, one of us had to enjoy a meal sitting on the bed. The microwave, fridge and coffee / tea maker were appreciated as no breakfast was available. Free coffee and tea sachets were provided. There were however no plates or bowls so eating-in was difficult. To travel downtown, take either the mono-rail or bus. The bus on First Ave was very convenient and cheap. We used the free bus service in town to see the various places of interets. Tip: Buy food and drinks at the Safeways supermarket and save yourself a packet. They had lovely hot dishes and salads and you were allowed to use their cafe section to eat your pre paid food, purchased in the supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler99
Reviews.Content: The location is great but it is hard to find. That is all that was really special. I am surprised this hotel is rated so highly. I wouldn't stay here for business but if your looking for a bargain downtown this would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMan423
Reviews.Content: Last winter, when a rare Seattle snow storm knocked out our power, I checked into this hotel with my teenage daughter. They only had one room left since many other locals were doing the same to keep warm. Despite the high demand, they did not gouge me. The room was small, but nice with a decent view of the Sound and the Space Needle. It's located in walking friendly lower Queen Anne with many good restaurants nearby and I cinema on the next block. Add the Starbucks on the ground floor and you can't ask for more for the money! Highly recommend if you don't need to be right downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place! Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: tbmumey
Reviews.Content: For the price, I doubt if you can find a better place in Seattle. We stayed at the Inn twice, bookending a cruise. At our first check in, they were able to give us our room at 10am! The 2nd time, at noon! Couldn't ask for better. The front desk staff was great. Even though we had booked thru hotels.com, we were given an air conditioned room (had read about the street noise) for both nights for no addtional charge (the hotel reservations lady could not have been nicer when we called to request a/c). Great location. Easy walk to Seattle Center (Space Needle, etc; catch the monorail down to near Pike Market). Beautiful views from roof deck. Close dining, movie theater, two grocery stores. I will definitely book at the Inn on our next trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: easy4mac
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, this is a great hotel - not a 4-star but just a comfortable place in an outstanding location. It was unpretentious and less corporate than a chain hotel. The staff was helpful and the room clean. The clientele were friendly and all seemed to be enjoying themselves. The hotel is located in a nice urban neighborhood and is convenient to the bus stops, restaurants, a Safeway (we bought some beer there and enjoyed Seattle's beautiful sunny weather on the hotel's rooftop deck for a couple of hours one afternoon - very relaxing), and to the Seattle Center. It seems like public transportation has improved quite a bit in the last several years, so as an adventure we took the city bus to and from the airport and were dropped off 1 block from the hotel. We walked to the Seattle Center and took the monorail downtown. We also walked to and from the Victoria Clipper terminal (pier 69) with our roller bags; this was a little hike back but through decent neighborhoods and we saw the Seattle sculpture park on the way. Breakfast at Pesos one block from the hotel was excellent, reasonably-priced, and provided some fun urban atmosphere. In summary, we had a wonderful time in Seattle and would definitely stay at the Mediterranean Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Great View”
Reviews.Author: comfam3
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Seattle and we stayed here for 4 nights. I rate this place highly because it is cheap, clean, all of the rooms have kitchenettes and it is in a great location. My wife and I stayed here with our baby and this place was great for us. The room was big enough for a travel crib. (Room 411) It was quiet. And best of all there are two grocery stores very close to the hotel to buy food from and avoid overpriced, crowded restaurants. (no fun with a baby) The Metropolitan Store has tons of great food that is ready to eat. Safeway is kind of a dump. The hotel is also less than a block away from the bus stop that will take you right to Pike Market and Pioneer Square. Let's face it, this isn't the Four Seasons. If you want that you have to pay for it. If you want to extend your stay by spending less on hotels, food, parking your car, and getting around....stay here. ps: the roof top view is almost as good as the Space Needle.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is HUH?”
Reviews.Author: lumpy_the_great
Reviews.Content: All I can say about the rave reviews here is HUH? We were in Seattle for a weekend event out by the airport. We stayed the first two nights at the airport Marriott which was excellent. But, for Sunday night, we decided we would try the Mediteranean so as to be downtown in the middle of everything. Considering the relative locations of the two and the fact that the Mediteranean was at least $40 (not including parking, isn't that nice of them) more a night we may as well have stayed at the Marriott. The room there was definitely a lot nicer as well as being a lot cheaper. The hotel itself definitely had a certain Hostel/Camp feel to it. The room is small and the bed is low and the tiny TV and stand alone VCR in the room were defintely the cherry on top. The staff is ok but largely ditzy and a little out of it. I kinda felt like I had wandered into a cool kids party back in high school. You know, where everyone is stoned and laughing at some in joke that you aren't a part of. The best thing to recommend this hotel is the location. It is right in the middle of everything and the neighborhood is very nice and has access to many of the great amenities. What would be really great is if they offered a bike rental serivice as that would get you anywhere in downtown. The hotel is ok, I would consider it to be a really basic, basic hotel with a good location. But extremely expensive for what you get. Overall it is clean and well maintained. But I just kept getting the feeling that I was paying a heck of a lot of money for a 2 star hotel. Do make sure you eat dinner at the Flying Fish just a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: hols100
Reviews.Content: I booked the Mediteraranean Inn hoping for a clean, safe and friendly place to stay, which is exactly what I got. The rooms are large and well-equipped, even having microwaves and fridges, which is always useful. The free internet in the lobby was fab, as was the on-site Starbucks. As for location, as a young female travelling alone I felt very safe going out at night, and there are plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. It's about a 20-minute walk into downtown Seattle but only 5-minutes from the Seattle Centre and Space Needle where there's a metro located for anyone not fancying the stroll. My only real complaint with the hotel was their refusal to accept my Maestro debit card - i didn't realise that in the US debit cards are accepted in very few places, and that a maestro card is virtually unheard of. Just in-case anyone out there is as oblivious as me...take a credit card or at the very least a visa debit with you before setting foot in the US!!

Reviews.Title: “great place!”
Reviews.Author: travelwork
Reviews.Content: I had a short stay in Seattle in May 2007, and was originally slated to stay at a highly rated B/B, but a series of unfortunate and aggravating events caused my plans to change as the B/B cancelled my reservation out from under me at the last minute. Fortunately, after browsing for several hours, I found the Mediterranean and oh, how GLAD I am that I did. I can't say enough about the service every step of the way, from start to finish. Well kept property for the price, perfect location (close to the Needle, on three bus lines, 24 hour Safeway across the street, the list goes on and on), nice amenities and beautiful sunrise and sunset views from the rooftop deck. Would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: justbeth1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mediterranean while attending a wedding over a long weekend earlier this month. While it's a bit of a drive from the airport, the location made it convenient to all the areas of Seattle we wanted to see- the Public Market, the docks, the Space Needle, etc. The neighborhood was safe and had a lot of different restaurants/coffee shops available. Our room was average size and the queen bed was fine. We didn't have air conditioning- but with the window open (ours faced an alley) or the fan on, the room was a good temp and we couldn't hear anything from the street. The bathrooms needed an update, but it was nice having a kitchenette w/fridge. Overall, the hotel was clean, and convenient for our needs. The price was reasonable for the quality- and the roof deck made up for anything that might have been lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Would Have, Could Have, Should Have been Better”
Reviews.Author: sixelagogo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in early August. I knew about the AC issue in advance and asked for an additional fan that they provided in the room. Overall, the place was decent, but I probably wouldn’t stay here again, as for $130 bucks a night, even in expensive Seattle, I’m convinced we could do better. Pros: Large room and bath; fridge and microwave bar kitchen; 3 free internet accessible computers in lobby; Great car service to airport (Mamu’s). Good location. Con’s: The bed, the bed the bed: It seems for all the cash the hotel may have spent on the kitchenette, they subtracted from the bed. We had a double bed (i.e., the size between queen and twin) for 2 people. It was a tight fit to say the least. This LITTLE TINY Bed in this gigantic room seemed ridiculous; The double bed we did get was HORRIBLE, with a sag in the middle. However much we tried to maintain some time of boundary in the tiny bed, my dude and I literally rolled into one another while trying to claw out of the pit. I agree with the previous poster that the place should have free wireless internet service. It just seems really cheap these days to not provide it to guests (especially when the whole town is practically wired). Not a bad place, but you could do better.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is -- but does that well”
Reviews.Author: kathleen_1227
Reviews.Content: This inn is nothing fancy, but it is clean and met our basic needs for a long weekend in Seattle. I appreciated the 2 bottled waters we found daily in the fridge, microwave popcorn, and Starbucks coffee for the coffee maker -- all free of charge. It was a touch loud outside, but not bad at all. We saved a couple bucks by getting a AAA discount and getting a room with a ceiling fan and oscillating floor fan instead of opting for A/C. It was August and we were completely comfortable (I cannot sleep if I'm hot). The neighborhood is decent. If you're in a walking mood, walk straight up (literally, straight up) Queen Anne and turn left at Highland for an amazing view! Probably just as good as the Space Needle's, and free. :) We also walked to Pike Place Market -- it's a good 30 minute walk, but it was pleasant enough and we didn't seem to go thru any seedy neighborhoods. We also took advantage of the car service -- $35 to the airport. It was prob $5 more than taking a cab, but it was nice to have a Town Car there waiting for us, plus the rate was flat, so no worries in case a draw bridge was up.

Reviews.Title: “It will depend on the room”
Reviews.Author: mrbeel
Reviews.Content: Okay, we kind of liked it but mainly for its location. We stayed for a long weekend and returned for another five days after we got back from Bellingham. The first stay had us on a warm evening in a third floor room with windows open right on the main drag and it is a heck of a noisy avenue with trucks and cars roaring by and coming off the stop light right outside the window. Reminded me of living in Manhattan on East 72nd. The return five days we insisted on a back room somewhere off the street and that is when things were much nicer and they accomodated us. The staff can be a bit indifferent, though not unfriendly. They seem pretty absorbed behind the front desk. The Starbucks in the building is convenient though I had to laugh when they made a big deal out of cashing a $50 for a $13 purchase. The Hotel does provide bottled water in the fridge when the maid remembers to replace them, no charge. They have a brand new and convenient laundromat on the first floor for visitors. There were a couple of computers in the lounge that you could check your email. Strangely enough in the land of microsoft there was no free internet in the building and nothing to hook up onto either at this location (for free). The location is great, the rooms not bad. If I sound luke warm... well, I am...

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much and you won't be dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: tedsredseat
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with a couple of the recent posts in that we booked this hotel based on numerous good reviews and a good price compared to anything downtown. The two major problems was that our room did not have air conditioning and the bed was just awful. We settled in too late the first night to realize that our room did not have a/c and didnt realize that a small portion of the rooms do (it isn't advertised at the hotel). It wasnt terribly warm in Seattle, but it was stuffy in the room and sleeping with the windows open is great until 6 am when the trucks begin to drive up and down the surrounding streets. We knew going in we would only have a queen bed, but the mattress and pillows were not comfortable at all. We had no problems with the staff or the cleanliness of the place and thought the location was great. In an old neighborhood with a few local bars/restaurants where you could avoid the downtown crush and a 10 - 15 minute walk to the Space Needle/Monorail etc. If you do stay here, request a room with a/c to allow you to keep your windows closed in the morning, unless your plans are to get up first thing in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Really poor quality--A very bad stay.”
Reviews.Author: worldwindow
Reviews.Content: I'm not so sure why so many people rate the Mediterranean Inn as well as they do. This is one of those hotels that's all about show and very little about quality. I chose to stay at the hotel because of the generally positive feedback from TripAdvisor and the overall appearance of the hotel based on the pictures I had seen. But upon arrival, it was obvious that the hotel would be lacking. Generally unlean, tacky decor, and the bare minimum of comforts define the hotel. I've stayed in many Best Westerns that are superior in these regards. Our room was tiny and bed uncomfortable and overly springy, with old and dirty looking sheets. The window was tiny, and despite what you see in the pictures, there are no balconies--just made to look that way. Our refrigerator didn' t work, there was no air conditioning, and despite a temperate 70 degree day in Seattle, the whole place managed to be stuffy and uncomfortable. One of the elevators was broken the whole stay as well. The staff were generally unconcerned about things and there never seemed to be enough of them to handle things properly. The price is less than many other quality hotels in Seattle, but don't make the mistake of comparing this hotel to anything nice. Compare it to a Best Western or Ramada Inn, and you'll still be far happier at one of those.

Reviews.Title: “Try the Mediterranean Inn”
Reviews.Author: TomandJudy
Reviews.Content: Very clean with very good staff. Our room had views of Puget Sound and the Olympic Moutains. Downtown edge neighborhood with great walks up Queen Anne Hill, a beautiful, restored neighborhood with views of the Sound, etc. Close to a few coffee/bakery shops and about a 1.2 mile walk to Pike Place Market. No air conditioning but with ceiling and oscillating fan. In July, we didn't need the AC, especially with our windows open.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: fancynanc85
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this great little hotel and was pleased with every aspect of my stay there! It was reasonably priced (for Seattle), the staff was friendly, the location was good and within walking distance to the Space Needle, and the room was perfect for my needs. Taxis are easy to catch right across the street and the best way to hit the tourist areas for just a few dollars. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who desires a quiet stay in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Seattle Location!”
Reviews.Author: nowwhatsnext
Reviews.Content: The Mediterranean Inn is a great alternative to the big chain hotels in Seattle. It's lower Queen Anne location is quieter and more relaxed than downtown, yet is only a block from the Seattle Center (Key Arena, Space Needle). You can ride the monorail for $2 if you want to get downtown, to Pike Market or the waterfront It only takes about three minutes and is actually very fun. There's also a roof top deck with Adirondack chairs for taking in the views of Seattle and Mount Rainier or just watching the sun set over Puget Sound. There are several great restaurants and coffee shops just up Queen Anne Ave. Pesos is great and very popular with the locals. There is also a Starbucks is on the first floor of the hotel. Our room was spotless, as was the rest of the property. The staff very friendly and helpful and there are two computers in the lobby for the guests. The laundry facilities were nice too. All in all, a great place to stay in Seattle. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: PMwhf
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves its great reviews. Its clean , quiet and well furnished with very friendly staff. Our room had two double beds with tv/dvd, microwave and coffee making facilities. There is a roof garden with superb views over the city. It is located in a very safe area with plenty of places to eat close by (there's a Starbucks in the lobby). Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “you cant go wrong by choosing the med”
Reviews.Author: Gomezkiller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Med for 2 nights in June while in Seattle for a concert at Key Arena (only 1 street over, maybe a 5 minute walk at most.) We were very satisfied with our choice. the staff was very friendly and my wife enjoyed having a Starbucks just an elevator ride away in the lobby. Our room was fine. The bed was comfortable, the TV had plenty of channels to choose from, the kitchenette worked, and the bathroom was large and spacious. We were in one of the rooms that had no A/C, but it was not an issue as the ceiling fan kept it cool and comfortable. We did open the windows in our room to allow some fresh air in and there was a bit of street noise (we were on the 3rd floor) not enough to bother us but a light sleeper may have issues. It was also great to have FREE internet in the lobby and a business office was also available, but we had no need for it. there are 2 supermarkets withing a block of the hotel and plenty of resturants in the area. If you are going on a cruise, anywhere near the Seattle Center or downtown, I would recommend this hotel for you. all of these areas are easily accessible from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: albertoV05
Reviews.Content: We stay 2 nights in May and we were absolutly satisfied by this hotel. The price is very good. The lobby is pleasant, with computers available. The room are big and clean. A good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bigperm86
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights to start our honeymoon and one night before departing after spending some time in Vancouver. The first two nights we had a Queen bed facing the Space needle which was very cool. The second stay we had a full size bed with no view, but like a previous reviewer wrote we took in the view on the first stay. The hotel is right next to Key Arena and Space needle, and is a Monorail ride away from Pike's Place Market. The room was very clean and had excellent water pressure and they give you two free bottles of water in the fridge. The lobby is very classy and there is a Starbucks connected to it. We left our cell phone charger on our first stay and after asking about it upon our return they had it. Definitely check out the roof top deck if the sun is shinning, you can take some excellent pictures. Also have the hotel call the car service they use to take you to the airport, I recommend using this as it is a flat rate and is a much better ride than a regular taxi. Strict No smoking policy, there is a $200 fee per nite if caught. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Curate's Egg”
Reviews.Author: V&J2003
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice within the space of a week, travelling to Vancouver in between to see family. The first room was excellent, with a great view of the Space Needle and skyline. The second room looked onto the car park, but I wasn't too bothered by that, as I'd already taken in the view. However, there was a walled off connecting door, which made the TV in the next room seem really loud. So we got moved. On the first occasion, we arrived exhausted from a 2 night train journey, realizing that we were too early for check in but hoping we might be able to do so. The very nice lady at the desk suggested we come back at 1pm, which we did, although we still had to wait another 40mins. That's fair enough - the check in time is clearly stated. The hotel has no restaurant and breakfast is not included. Obviously I was aware of this when booking, but thinking about it it was pretty expensive considering. This being Seattle, there is a Starbucks on the ground floor. They also provide a fridge and microwave. The location is great for the Space Needle and other attractions. The area is pleasant, although there are quite a few homeless people about. There are plenty of places to buy groceries and food, including a fantastic pizza place. There are 2 screens with keyboards and internet connections in the lobby. You have to stand to use them, which I guess is to prevent people hogging them for hours. The building is modern and functional; hardly 'mediterranean', but not bad as a base for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly thoughtful hotel”
Reviews.Author: erbprinz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mediterranean Inn for 5 nights in mid April 2007. Since it was a "budget" hotel I wasn't expecting much, but after reading the reviews in Trip Advisor, decided it might be OK. We had a 4th floor corner room towards the back of the hotel which made it nice and quiet, we had a view of the mountains and TWO windows that opened in our room - We had 4 plush pillows, a comfortable bed, large CLEAN bathroom, plenty of towels. The Mediterranean exceeded our expectations. It seemed that every little detail, often overlooked in more luxurious accommodations were thoughtfully provided. Water in the fridge, popcorn, microwave. It even had an iron and ironing board in the room. The room was very clean and the fact that it was a non smoking hotel was great. No lingering stink from smokers on other floors that seep thru the duct work. We also loved the location - about 10 restaurants within a two block wall. Close to the bus to downtown. The Starbucks adjoining the hotel was a plus and the roof top deck was the icing on the cake for us. We will definintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location/value for those who can walk”
Reviews.Author: Horshack
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel near the city center that wouldn't break the bank, yet keep us close to the attractions of the downtown area. The Med fits the bill for those who don't mind a bit of a walk - though the walk itself is through nice downtown areas with plenty of shops and restaraunts. If you don't feel like making the mile or so trek back after a night on the town, a cab ride from Pike's Market area is less than $10 (and worth it if it is raining). The staff was friendly, and there is a Starbucks inside the main level. While you won't get wireless internet in the rooms, there are two terminals located in the lobby, and a business center with three more computers and printers on the main floor as well. The workout room was unimpressive, but if you are hard-core you will probably prefer to run along the waterfront anyway. All and all a good choice for younger travelers or those who don't mind a quick cab ride to save some coin on the hotel room price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: cambriant
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mediterranean from 16-20 March 2007. Booked the hotel after reading the reviews on tripadvisor and I must say it was as good as we hoped it would be. As we were traveling with our 20 month old toddler, we really wanted to stay somewhere central and clean. Mediterranean Inn had everything we need. From a sink to wash dirty cups to a microwave to heat up milk and fridge, we were glad with the amenities. I remembered reading some reviews saying not to stay in the rooms next to the street, so I called in advance to reserve a room on a higher floor and away from the street level. That was helpful as we were on the fifth floor with a slight view of the Olympic Mountains and Puget Sound. It was quiet and we were able to get a good night rest. The only thing that I wished the hotel provided were plates/bowls and utensils and of course dishwashing liquid for us to wash stuff (maybe a small packet of cleaning supplies?). The bathroom was alright though I wished the water power from the showerhead would be stronger. And also, it would really be nice if the quality of the toilet paper was better. But like many have commented, this is not a luxury hotel, but it was perfect for our weekend stay in Seattle. Two things that I really liked about the Inn is its proximity to Safeway (just opposite). It made it so easy for us to drop by the supermarket on the way back to the hotel to pick up milk, snacks, stuff for our son. Another plus is having Starbucks in the lobby. The smell of fresh coffee as you walk into the lobby is priceless. The first morning we were there, I woke up extra early, bought myself a caramel macchiato from Starbucks and went to the rooftop to catch the sunrise. It was perfect. Some good places for food around the inn include Phuket, a small Thai restaurant just across the street on Queen Anne Ave. Not a lot of choices but food is relatively tasty and reasonably priced. We also tried Roti, an Indian restaurant just a little further down Queen Anne Ave across the street and its amazing! One good tip for those coming from the airport would be to call the inn the day before and get their personal car service to pick you up. Its a $35 flat rate. As we were traveling with a toddler, it really helped not to worry about transportation to the hotel from the airport and just enjoy a stress free ride.

Reviews.Title: “Precisely as expected.”
Reviews.Author: frankfurtermadchen
Reviews.Content: This is a great budget hotel in a nice neighborhood in Seattle. I was hoping for somewhere clean, safe, and in a good location for seeing Seattle. I believe it fufilled all those requirements. What it is NOT is a luxury hotel. The rooms are plain, but pleasant and tidy. They provide free bottled water in the mini fridge, along with microwave popcorn, and starbucks coffee. They have basic cable tv, no pay-per-view options but a VCR (! uhm, how about a DVD player instead?) The beds are adequate but strangely hollow feeling, very springy. Still comfortable though. The bathroom is spacious and clean, though the tub is kind of on the small side and the shower water pressure isn't strong like I prefer. The bathroom has a large framed mirror, but it would have been nice to have a full length mirror available in the room. One noticible drawback is that it was a little bit noisy. We kept checking the windows because it sounded like one of them was open due to the audible traffic noises outside. Staff is friendly and helpful. They have laundry facilities along with several vending machines for snacks and beverages. They also offer a free 24hour workout room that was very nice to have access to. (treadmill, stationary bike, elliptical machine, weight machine, they provide towels, apples, fans, and a small tv.) There is a nearby 24hr grocery store, Dick's hamburgers across the street for late night munchies (open until 2am) and really delicious pizza by the slice at Pagliacci's one block down. Seattle Center (space needle, science center!) and Key Arena are both just a very short walk away. The Mediterranean is : Clean, convenient, and friendly. The Mediterranean is not: fancy or quiet. I would recommend it for family or budget travellers, not so much for business or romantic trips.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: kdaisy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights at the Mediterranean Inn in Seattle in March of 2007. I found the hotel through this site and I have to say it exceeded my expectations. It was clean and extremely comfortable. We had a view of the space needle from our fourth floor room with a comfy window seat. The location couldn't be beat. It is within walking distance of the space needle and Seattle Center. One of the best breakfasts in Seattle is just a block up at the Mecca Cafe. And the monorail from Seattle Center takes you right downtown in minutes. Internet access in the rooms was only a $5 surcharge. Thanks to this website and to the Mediterranean for such a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended for tourists!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tinskie143
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights from February 21-23, 2007. We decided to book in this Hotel based from the Internet reviews made by Expedia/Trip Advisor travellers! Personally speaking, we both are quite impressed with the hotel in terms of cleanliness, customer service, amenities, and the location of the hotel! Hotel staff are very helpful, friendly and accommodating, the one complaint I have is that we didn't get the Space Needle view in our window, although my husband and I enjoyed the Hotel's roof- top view of Seattle during the night! The location of the hotel is just walking distance to Seattle Center, as well as downtown Seattle! Apart from the Hotel, I highly recommend the Argosy cruise tours--Harbor and Lake Seattle...it was such a treat that we saw Bill Gates' mansion along Lake Washington via Argosy Lake Seattle cruise! Anyhow, a definite "A" rating for the Meditteranean Hotel, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: homebody00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over a long weekend while attending a wedding. We loved it. The room was very clean and functional (although there was not a lot of space to put toiletries in the bathroom). If you have more than one person to a bed, make sure you get a room with a queen size bed, because some of them have full size. The "kitchenette" was a bit overrated in the hotel website's description. It was really just a microwave, minifridge, and sink - but it did the job for our purposes. There was no air conditioning, but the ceiling fan worked just fine for us - even in August. Location was great - right across from Seattle Center where the Space Needle is. We were able to take buses to other points, such as Pike Place Market (though this is walkable if you like long walks). Free internet access in the lobby helped us plan our sightseeing. If you stay here don't miss the beautiful view from the roofdeck!

Reviews.Title: “Bright and cheery place in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Libbety
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true gem! Very bright and cheery even on the most overcast days. Located in a A vibrant, hip neighborhood at the foot of Queen Anne hill. Everything is within walking distance. The rooms are nicely furnished and comfortable. Check out the newly opened Metropolitan Market just a few blocks away for an unforgettable culinary mecca of a market! Lots of good restaurants and shops within a 3 block radius. Just a few block away from the Seattle Center and Bell Town. A nice walk to the Pike Place Market. All in all, a great little hotel in a fantastic location. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place on The Cheap!!”
Reviews.Author: rakasome
Reviews.Content: Well this place was a total surprise for Seattle. Close proximity to EVERYTHING. My daughter had told us about the place. Totally affordable, across the street from all the Seattle Center stuff, and downtown just a short hop. We had GREAT views of Elliot Bay. Ask for the 6th floor, western exposure. For some extra cash, the underground parking was truly exceptional. Spend the money. Staff was VERY nice and VERY helpful. The only negative was the truly crappy bed. Thin, lumpy, and if someone coughed, you got thrown out the other side. Not too bad for around a C note per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sierra_Van
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a two-night stay because of it's close proximity to Key Arena (just one block away), and I was very impressed. The hotel is bright and the rooms very clean (though I would bring a pillow case from home - their's are paper thin). The front desk personel were very friendly and accommodating. The rooms do have a microwave and mini-fridge, but do not have any utensils of any kind, so you may want to bring anything you think you'll need. The bus stop into town is a half block away, the Safeway is right next door (so handy!), there are several pubs, restaurants and fast-food places surrounding the hotel, and you cannot beat the Starbucks directly off the lobby. I would highly recommend this hotel. And if you do stay here, you cannot leave without checking out the roof top deck (what a view!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: snaproll21
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent a week at the Mediterranean during November 2006. The room was perfectly adequate, nothing fancy or lavish, but a nice bed, clean, full bathroom, big enough fridge, etc. Not a room you'll spend much time in, but there's plenty right outside to enjoy. We tried a handful of great restaurants within 2 blocks (everything from Thai food to an Irish pub w/great pot pies). There's a nice bar a block away. A movie theater and a Safeway half a block away.
