The Seattle center is about a 5 minute walk (2 blocks) with Key Arena (see the Sonics while they're still there), the Space Needle (good restaurant and not insanely expensive), a food court, kids stuff, a GREAT music museum (don't miss it!), and much more (lots of kids stuff if you have kids). Also the monorail is right there ($2) which will take into downtown--only a mile away and an easy walk if you choose--and drop you off right in the thick of things in the Westlake shopping center which itself is a 6 to 9 minute walk to Pike's Market. So overall, the hotel is very nice with a decent gym and clean, nice rooms. But what really makes it is the location. You won't need a car or a cab all week! Plenty to do and see. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: shreevie
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel on the internet a couple of weeks before my holiday as we were looking for something relatively cheap. When we arrived the room was clean and spacious. The bathroom was huge. They even through in some free popcorn for you! Even though breakfast isn`t included there is a starbucks inside the hotel. The location was great for getting to the Space Needle, and even walking into downtown Seattle took about half an hour. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great views”
Reviews.Author: silentcmh
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here on 10/18-10/20. We just stayed two nights before going down to Oregon so we wanted a hotel affordable yet close to all the main tourist spots. I loved the area it was in. I'd really love to spend some more time in the Queen Anne area in the future. There are more than enough restaurants and bars in easy walking distance. I highly recommend starting your day with a big (yet very affordable) breakfast at the Mecca cafe! We winded up going there both mornings. The walk to Pike Place took about 25 minutes or so. We just walked down 1st Ave to get there. It's a pleasant walk and we enjoyed it, but it may be too far a walk for some people. The Space Needle is just two blocks away, definitely an easy walk. And if you want to catch a Sonics game, the Key Arena is just a few steps away. As for the hotel itself, it has its ups and downs. The front desk staff was helpful albeit very disinterested. I'm sure they've all heard the same questions (How do I get to the Space Needle/Market/ etc?) a thousand times, but they don't need to act like they're bored and tired of answering them. Two computers with free internet in the lobby is nice. We had a postcard worthy view from our room with the Space Needle and downtown skyline (532 I believe). And of course the observation deck on the roof is beautiful even on the cloudy days that we had. The biggest room for improvement is the beds. They're quite awful. The mattresses are uncomfortable and the pillows are TERRIBLE. They're tiny, flat, and provide very little comfort and no support. When I vacation in Seattle again, I would definitely stay at the Mediterranean if I stay in the Queen Anne district. All in all it's a good hotel. However, I would bring my own pillows and blanket even if it meant checking in an extra bag at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Forget Overpriced Downtown Seattle Hotels”
Reviews.Author: audzky
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights and I loved this little hotel. The room was clean and there was a kitchenette. The staff was very helpful, they kept our luggage for us because we got there way before the check in time. They put tags on our luggage and placed them in the back room. There were 2 computers w/ internet on the lobby, a gym and not to mention the starbucks downstairs. The bus stops are a block away which takes you to Downtown Seattle and Pioneer Square for $1.25 and it runs late. Downtown Seattle also has a ride free zone so you can pretty much go around Downtown Seattle for free and you don't have to worry about parking. There are a couple of good places to eat and shop near the hotel - check out Pagliacci's (awesome salad) and Underdawg Records (awesome music collection & the owner was very friendly and helpful). The Seattle Center (Space Needle, EMP, Pacific Science Center, Children's Museum) is about 2 blocks away. There's a Safeway and a 24 hour neighborhood grocery store around the corner. Do not miss the rooftop deck - it has an awesome view of Downtown Seattle, Queen Anne Hill, Elliot Bay & the Space Needle. You can also walk if you're comfortable walking about a mile or more. We walked from the Bellmont District to our hotel and it was not that bad. To get to and from the airport, call the hotel for a car service (Mr. Maru $35.00) - if you take a cab, it will cost you the same, if not more. The car was roomy and clean, and he avoided the traffic by going on the side streets - imagine if you're taking a cab and how much this would have cost you. The driver was very friendly and very professional. If you must take a cab - take the yellow or orange cabs. I will definitely stay here again and will recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: AD_WDC
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here, and would definitely both recommend it and stay here again. While not in downtown, it was easy to get around with the bus (stop a block away, 4-5 lines) and free transfers. The surrounding area (Lower Queene Anne) had good restaurants (Racha, Pesos, Caffe Ladro) and stores (music, books, safeway, drug store). The hotel decor was fine (nothing special and nothing mediterranean about it, a bit dated) and everything was clean. Rooftop view was amazing, free bottled water in the room was great, free internet in the lobby also was helpful. Front desk was extremely helpful with directions, getting messages, extra keys, etc. Not necessarily a place to stay for a romantic weekend getaway, but for anything else, it works.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Pastry_Princess
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean rooms, good amenities, great rooftop view. Only a few rooms have AC so beware when you book if it's summer. Easy to get downtown with the bus schedule and stop a block away. Good, safe parking garage below the hotel, although you would not park your large SUV there. I would definitely book again, specifying a room with AC if in warm months. The only thing that would have made the stay better was a slightly more comfortable bed, thicker pillows, and free internet ($5 daily or $15 weekly).

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Darylemad
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay (over Labor Day weekend) in Seattle at the Mediterranean Inn. I will definitely stay there again the next time I find myself in Seattle. I thought the rates were reasonable, the location is fantastic, and the rooms are great. As for location...it is right in the heart of the Queen Anne district. There are several restaurants, pubs, and coffee shops within a couple of blocks. There is a Safeway just across the street as well as a movie theater. It is also just a couple of blocks from the Seattle Center (the Space Needle, Key Arena, as well as other venues/sights.) If you are going to the Bumbershoot festival, you can't get a better location. We did walk to Pike Place Market. It took us around 20 minutes, so I know that won't be for everyone. There is a city bus stop a block up the street and the front desk staff were very helpful with public transportation instructions. The Starbucks in the lobby of the hotel is very convenient. We got our morning coffee at Starbucks and went straight up to the deck to enjoy the view & the gorgeous weather. As for the room...our room was on the 3rd floor of the hotel, not facing the street. It was clean except for a couple of stains on the carpet. The bed was comfortable and the shower was excellent. The room had a fridge and microwave. They provided 2 bottles of water, coffee, and a bag of microwave popcorn. We did not have air conditioning, but there was a ceiling fan and I noticed that some rooms had oscillating fans so I guess you can ask for one. Our room stayed comfortable since it didn't really get any sun and the nights were cool. We slept with the window open; it was quiet since we didn't face a street. I guess if I had to come up with one complaint, it would be that the parking spaces were really small. I have a compact car, so it wasn't a problem but I would have a hard time parking a big car. Parking was $12 per night, under the hotel in a very secure garage. All in all, it was a great stay and I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: shaznatiger
Reviews.Content: After searching for an affordable hotel in Seattle for 2 nights, I decided on the Mediterranean Inn. I had read the reviews on this site, so I somewhat knew what to expect. First the good: The location is great....a quick walk to Seattle Center and short drive to Pike Place Market and the waterfront. The view from the top desk was fantastic as well! The bad: Having the windows open because of no A/C would have been fine if the traffic didn't continue to be loud all night! There is a stand up fan and a ceiling fan in the room, but our ceiling fan had so much dust on it we were sneezing when we turned it on. The bathroom doesn't have much room to put your toiletries out. The shower was not bad though. The first morning we were there we went to leave our room and our door would not latch shut. Then both of our key cards stopped working the second day. The people at the front desk seemed like they wanted to be anywhere but there. The beds weren't all the great either. We were in a queen room, but my 6'4" fiance swears the bed was only a double! If you're not looking for frills this place is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ustraveler100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mediterranean Inn for three nights. Our room was on the sixth floor, it had a great view of Elliot Bay and downtown. Yes, our room had air conditioning, though weather was great and we did not use it. Nice touches to the room included bottled waters in the refrigerator, and a pack of microwave popcorn. The business center and lobby have free internet access, which came in quite handy to check in for our flights prior to going to the airport. They also have a nice laundry area, fitness room and the rooftop deck which offers a great view! If you are hungry there are many restaurants nearby, grocery and drugstore if you forget something-open 24 hours. Also a short walk to Seattle Center, the Monorail is open, $4.00 roundtrip ride to downtown. Waterfront area is a little longer, but you can catch the free route 99 bus at Pier 70 which makes many stops along the waterfront and Pioneer Square/Chinatown. You can walk a few long blocks from Pioneer Square area to take in a tour of Safeco Field or Qwest Field on non-game days. We really enjoyed our stay at the Mediterranean Inn and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, No Air Conditioning”
Reviews.Author: Exploremt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a quick trip to Seattle. We stayed 3 days at the Mediterranean Inn. The location is great, the staff was nice, the room was spacious, and there was a nice little mini kitchennette. The room also had a great window seat which I would reccommend requesting when booking. The problem was that there was no air conditioning in the rooms! It was a hot summer weekend in Seattle, and the room was almost unbearable. We were in the room for about 30 seconds before I called the front desk to ask where the A/C controls were, and were told that there was none. There was a ceiling fan, and the staff brought us an ossillating fan which helped, but not nearly enough. Luckily we were busy during the day and did not spend much time in the room. I would definitely reccommend this hotel, just not in the summer. Apparently they do have a few rooms with A/C on the 6th floor, which I was told were only $10 more ($138) so if you can get one of those, go for it. I have never stayed in a hotel with no A/C and really can't understand why a nice place like this would not have it. The lobby is blissfully cool, but don' t let that fool you. As I said, I would certainly stay there again, but not when there is any chance of warm weather.

Reviews.Title: “95 degree heat and No Air Conditioning”
Reviews.Author: txwebber
Reviews.Content: Most of the rooms in this hotel have no air conditioning. There is no information of this when booking online, nor is there an option to select a room with air conditioning. The weather was very hot in the 90's during my entire stay. The room was completely impossible to be in between the hours of 9 am until 3 am. My heart goes out to an elderly person that may stay here during hot weather. I am from Houston, TX and very use to hot weather; however the temperature of this room was so exteme, even I could not take it. The location is decent, a short walk to the Space Needle, but if you plan on staying here...... for your own health, DO NOT STAY DURING A HOT WEEKEND!

Reviews.Title: “A gem near the Space Needle”
Reviews.Author: bbzebra
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five nights at this quaint hotel in the Queen Anne area of Seattle and we could not have been happier. You can see the Space Needle from the hotel, especially if you go to the roof top viewing area. We had one of the rooms with a bay window which gave us some extra room, and a view of the Needle. The staff was very friendly, knowledgeable and eager to assist. While it is not the fanciest hotel in town, it is probably the best buy for your money. And, there is a Starbucks on the bottom floor!! We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at the Mediterranean Inn”
Reviews.Author: JulietLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I want to highly recommend the Mediterranean Inn in Seattle, Washington. My husband and I stayed there for 3 days, very clean, comfortable and central. Specially want to thank the staff Shiela, La Tonya, John and Ross for being so helpful. We would definitely go back. Juliet and Salus De Souza, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: balderdash
Reviews.Content: Great for the money. Starbucks attached, Internet in lobby, Walking distance to Market, etc. Paid about 150 after taxes per night, and thought it was well spent. Would recommend anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall stay”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTraveler014
Reviews.Content: I would strongly recommend the Mediterranean Inn. For the money it was a great place to stay. The convenience to the buses and to the Seattle Center, the cleanliness of the room, and the roof top terrace were all pluses. Only negative was some street noise but with the fan running, which kept the room amazingly cool during a heat wave, most was blocked out. Plus we were too tired from running around Seattle! Someone mentioned the staff''s lack of familiarity with the Seattle area--but we have found that everywhere in the N.W. area--most people seem to commute to their jobs and don't know about the immediate area. Loved Starbucks attached to the lobby, the Starbucks coffee in the room, microwave and much more.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Malfred
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of June. Double room was spacious and the kitchenette was a big bonus with fridge and micowave. Decor was not new, but was really clean. Free internet in the lobby was a big bonus, and the hotel has an internal door linking thru to the next door Starbucks which is handy for breakfast. Staff all pleasant and helpful. Great location for Seattle Centre, Space Needle, Key Arena etc. Handful of nice bars and restaurants close to the hotel, and generally a nice neighbourhood - try 5 Spot at the top of Queen Ann for a great meal if you can manage the walk up the very steep hill! Supermarket and 24 hour drugstore also 1 block away. At least 20 to 25 minute walk from downtown - this is ok in good weather, but worth being aware of. The monorail goes from Seattle Centre to downtown, and should be an excellent way of easily and cheaply getting downtown - but it was undergoing repairs for the whole of our stay and was out of action so beware! Taxi to the edge of downtown only about $7-8 + tip. Overall, if you are happy to stay slightly out of downtown then this is a good affordable choice.

Reviews.Title: “business traveler will not return to the mediterranean”
Reviews.Author: fluoresce
Reviews.Content: I have been to Seattle weekly for the past two months and usually stay at a couple other hotels. I will not return to the Mediterranean - I had a noisy street side room, the parking was $22 a night and the garage was poorly lit, the non-smoking room was slightly smoky, the furnishings were old and not clean (cigarette burn on the uncomfortable desk chair). There are better places to stay for the same amount of money. Potential pluses: connected internally to the Starbucks next door, in neighborhood with good restaurants, particularly Thai and a hamburger joint, says it's a AAA rated location

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: mannyduck
Reviews.Content: Management and staff keep up the good work!! Were there for one night with Son and Daughter in law. 1. Gave us several reccomendations for restaurants. 2. Stored our luggage for us while we were running around. 3. Were constantly seen cleaning lobby areas and rooftop. Rooms were clean and comfortable. 4, Free Water, Popcorn, and Starbucks coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Good Things Going for It”
Reviews.Author: aklein1022
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights the first week of June. We asked for a quiet room with a view and got Room 621. The room was on the small side with a partial view of Elliott Bay. The bathroom was spacious and the room had a refrigerator and coffee machine. The best things about this hotel are the following: the roof deck where you can sit in Adirondack chairs and admire the views of the Bay with ferries and cruise ships and the Seattle skyline; free Internet access in the lobby on two machines and a separate "Business Center" with printers, etc.; a Starbucks, also in the lobby; a small fitness center and laundry room; easy access to downtown and the Pike's Market via three bus lines less than one block from the hotel; walking distance to the Space Needle and the Seattle Center. The hotel could be closer to the action, but that's why the price is so reasonable. Nearby breakfast places (and I'm not talking about a Starbucks) were not too plentiful. We did find one about 2 blocks away - Buckley's. Very good and inexpensive. It is very likely that we will visit Seattle again and will certainly consider staying at the Mediterranean Inn.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcniii
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at the Mediterrenean especially for the price. While not downtown we were within walking distance to the Space Needle and what is called Seattle Center. No air conditioning but comfortable with the fan in the room although leaving the window open at night left you listening to whatever or whoever decided to make noise outside...The rooftop view is great, everyone who stays here needs to go and check it out. Beds comfortable, rooms and bathroom good sized. My only complaint is the staff didn't seem to know anything about Seattle. When asked about dining or anything else was told, "Don't know anything about it". Check out the Mecca Restaurant down the street for breakfast...told it was a greasy spoon but the food was great, even if they give you enough hash browns to serve an army! Safeway across the street and ATM also across the street..easy to catch cabs or the bus if you like.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Staff, Great Hotel :o)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thanks TripAdvisor for all the reviews, you did not disappoint! My Wife and I stayed at the Mediterranean Inn last weekend and absolutely enjoyed our 3 night stay. The staff was very friendly, courteous and helpful. Our room was very clean, the bathroom was decent in size, the bed was very comfortable, the mini fridge and microwave were very handy and the complimentary popcorn and bottled waters were great little perks (which were replenished daily) We had an amazing view of the Space Needle to our left and the Sound to the right! The view from the rooftop was absolutely breath-taking a must see! Very close to Downtown Centre. The Space Needle, Science Centre, EMP and Key Arena are a few minutes walk away! A variety of restaurants within walking distance as well. Close enough but still far enough away from the noise of the downtown core! We willl definately stay at The Mediterranean any time we visit Seattle and will recommend it to our family and friends!!!! When in Seattle check out the Mediterranean Inn you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: Maria F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in the Mediterranean Hotel on Queen Anne Ave at the beginning of May. The hotel itself lacked totally in character, was poorly decorated (i.e. no window dressing at all, just vertical blinds), the room was very small, the bathroom tiny and there was a 'stale' smell in it. Also, the room we were in the window did not close properly. It was extremely bad value for money as other hotels in which we have stayed in Seattle were far superior and some were quite a lot cheaper that this one. When we arrived on Friday afternoon the staff on duty then and for the entire weekend gave the impression they really did not want to be there! When we were checking out on Monday morning a different person was on reception and she was very pleasant. Our advice is avoid this place if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find!”
Reviews.Author: lkm
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent two nights in Seattle earlier this month and, on the recommendations of this board, stayed at the Mediterranean. The hotel was very nice but nothing fancy. The rooftop deck is a great place to sit and read on a sunny day. There were coffee and coffee makers in the room as well as microwave popcorn. There was also a little office room with computers and FREE internet access which was very nice. I would definately go back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back to Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the cost, the hotel is a great value. It is close to the space needle and the Key Area. We had read other reviews that said it was centrally located in downtown - and we didn't quite agree with that. First of all, the room was OK - we got a room on the first floor right off from the lobby. The staff at the hotel was accomadating and helpful. For the price, this hotel was a good find for us. We are young newlyweds who didn't want to spend a fortune to stay in Seattle for the weekend. The only downside for us was the distance from the city. It took us about 20-25 minutes to walk from the Pike Place Market to the hotel. We needed the exercise, so it wasn't a big problem, but we weren't under the impression (from the hotel website and other reviews) that the hotel that far from downtown (when you read other reviews that say 'centrally located', that's not what we pictured). I will say that the hotel is in a nicer neighborhood. I have stayed closer to Belltown several times for work, and have been weery of walking alone, but I didn't feel that way this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slow-travel
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I decided to go to Seattle for a shopping weekend and the Mediterranean was $100 US less expensive than chain hotels right downtown. I had problems with the hotel website and booked directly and got a price lower than the web price. The room was basic, but clean and nicely laid out, with the added advantage of the kitchen area for snacks. The hallways and public areas were spotless. We had the corner room fronting two streets, so were worried about noise, but the area is quiet after 11, so that wasn't a problem. The front desk staff were all helpful. From the hotel to the Pike Place Market area is a pleasant 45 minute walk or $7 cab ride, and there are good bistro-type restaurants in the neighbourhood. Note regarding parking. The hotel has a well-secured (hotel room key access) parkade under the building. When you check in, park in the loading zone in front of the hotel and the clerk will give you instructions on how to access the parkade. We spent time trying to figure it out beforehand.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: streake
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night on our way from the airport to whistler. The room was clean and accomodating, the coffee maker and fridge make a difference. The room was small and the bed a little uncomfortable so it is best for a one or two night stay. The service was great, the front desk went online and printed me out directions to a restaurant I was asking about, it doesn't get much better than that. The parking lot was full the night we stayed b/c of a concert so we parked at a meter an put some quarters in at 8 and moved it by 10am. Saved the $12 so we weren't upset. Not a bad option (especially for a $100 price.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bigfellahull
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Clean, friendly, comfortable. I stayed there for two weeks and will definitely be back. The room while basic was perfect for what I needed. Complementary coffee, cokes and popcorn every morning. The starbucks just off the lobby is great; the aroma every morning is just amazing. Has laundry facilities, small but functional gym, and a 'business centre' where you can use their computers for work, sending pics home etc. It’s close to everything. 5 minute walk to pier 69, 3 minute walk to the Seattle Centre and only a two minute monorail ride to downtown. All in all a great hotel, perfect if you want somewhere clean and friendly to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel. Friendly Staff. Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: Christyn95
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Seattle from Oct 29th - Nov 1st and enjoyed our stay at the Mediterranean Inn. We had an easy check-in and check-out. We had never been to Seattle, so we had a multitude of questions for the hotel staff, and they were very very nice and always gave an answer with a smile - they even went the extra mile a few times. The hotel also had 2 computers set up with the internet, for guests to use w/o a reservation, and then they also had a business room with more computers and printers. The access to the internet was very helpful, when trying to find new things to do and to check email away from home. The hotel is centrally located. Although it is not in the middle of downtown, it is within easy walking distance to City Center where you can take the monorail that takes you downtown, as well as to the Sonics Stadium and the Space Needle. We stayed on the 6th floor and had a nice view of the lake, as well as the Space Needle (if we looked out towards the left). We took advantage of the outlook on the roof, on our first night (when it was dry) to look out at the beautiful city. As we all know, people that live in Seattle drink a lot of coffee, so there is a Starbucks on the lobby level of the hotel. We did not go to that Starbucks, but it was nice to know it was there. The only quirks that the hotel had was the parking fee and the bed. The hotel charges $12.00 a day for guests to park in the garage. Also, the beds were a bit too bouncy -everytime my husband would turn in his sleep, I'd bounce all over the place and I would wake up with an achey back. All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellently located hotel with great service and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Located in great section of the downtown area, lots of excellent restaurants, bars, clubs, and pubs! Space Needle and many other things in close walking distance! Excellent service with a great little room!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service? I think not.”
Reviews.Author: elea
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here before attending the U2 concert. This hotel is conveniently located 2 blocks from Key Arena AND has a Starbucks in it's lobby. Who could ask for more?! Nothing fancy- but very clean and very convenient. Our disappointment came when we received our VISA statment and found an extra charge of $50 from the hotel. When I called to inquire, I was told it was because there was smoke damage to the room. There is just one problem: My husband and I have never smoked in our lives! Furthermore, if we had been placed in a "smoking room" I would have complained and requested a move. The customer service was non-existent. I was told they would not remove the charge. Housekeeping had made the claim that someone had smoked in that room and they weren't willing to accept my word that it wasn't us. I placed a claim with my VISA account and they looked into it. The charge was finally removed after about 4 months. I was disappointed and will not be able to patronize this hotel again. I do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Weird Beds!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, brilliant value, large rooms with above average kitchenette and bathrooms kept lovely and clean. Slightly strange beds though...... small and not 100% comfortable. Fab rooftop terrace more than makes up for this, wish I was there now sipping a cold drinky! The lower Queen Anne area seemed very laidback with a good selection of bars and great value places to eat, Racha Noodles in particular. We were very glad we choose to stay here instead of downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel And A Great Price!!”
Reviews.Author: DEANOG
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my trip to Seattle. I stayed at this hotel. It's in a good spot 20 minute walk from hotel down to Qwest Field to watch the Seattle Seahawks play. 5 Minute walk to the Space Needle. Safeway just next door to get your bits and pieces. Rooms are fine and bright. What else are you looking for in a hotel? It had a comfy bed nice shower/bath, fridge, microwave. It was clean and you got loads of towels. Plus free internet access in the lobby. Staff very friendly. I will be back at this hotel on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Sarasota, Florida”
Reviews.Author: Bob_Mannino
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - a very short walk to the Seattle Center, one block to the bus stop, plus a Movie Theater, grocery stores, restaurants are all within a few blocks of the hotel. Rooms were clean and comfortable, and the staff was very helpful. Hotel is located in a very convenient, upper middle class neighborhood. I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveltrooper
Reviews.Content: The positive points- Location: The Mediterranean Inn is located in the best part of Seattle. I have visited Seattle at least a dozen times and this area is perfect for couples or families. Amenities: The hotel offers very nice kitchenettes with microwaves. If you get a chance- take the elevator to the roof and take in an amazing view of the city. The negative points- the bed was the smallest and most uncomfortable to sleep in with someone else. The room would be fine for one person or two very small people. The bathroom was quite "institutional" with large open garbage cans, ugly hospital like flooring, and tacky plastic moldings around the bathtub. There was only one small mirror in the room- in the bathroom. I won't return to this hotel but if I was a young single "20 something" student this hotel would be fine. Kate

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: SuziR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mediterranean for 3 nights this summer. The staff were very helpful on arrival and gave us a key to the underground carpark ($12 per night) without us checking in. The first room we were given was ok but the bed was a pullout and not very big. I phoned down to reception to ask for a bigger bed (my husband is 6'4") and were told that was a fullsize!! 2 minutes later the phone rang and we were given a room with a queen size bed. The room was clean and the fridge was very handy for chilling beer (complimentary cokes a nice touch) The roof terrace has fabulous views (especially good at night) and the free internet access was a real bonus. The location of the hotel is ideal, Safeway supermarket around the corner, Seattle Centre a few blocks over and bars/restaurants within walking distance. The walk to downtown (Pike Place market etc) is about 20 minutes through Belltown which has some nice restaurants too. The monorail is a quick way of getting downtown though if your feet are aching!! Overall, a good value for money, city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the rough!”
Reviews.Author: catador
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is not luxurious, but it is impeccably mantained, and it has everything for almost everyone. Located two blocks from the Space Needle, it is walking distance to great restaurants: from a reliable hamburger joint accross the street, to great pizza a block away, to every conceivable ethnic food, as well as fine dinning establishments. The rooms are smallish, but functional, with a sink, fridge, coffee maker, and microwave. There is one supermarket accross the street, and another two blocks away. Parking is available at a very reasonable cost, under the building. The hotel has no restaurant, but there is the ubiquitous Starbucks, connected to the lobby. I would avoid it like the plague! Seattle has dozens of better coffeehouses, some of them part of a bakery. Ask the very friendly and efficient desk staff for directions to "Macrina", a justifiably famous bakery, walking distance from the hotel. If you add a nice lobby, complimentary computer access, a small gym, a coin operated laundry room, and the "drop-dead-gorgeous" view from the rooftop, you can easilly see why the Mediterranean Inn made our six day vacation in Seattle, an added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rates, service, location”
Reviews.Author: adammlowe
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel for so many reasons. When I first arrived the room had an odd smell, so the staff pleasantly changed me to another room without question. The room was clean and everything was in excellent condition. You can also access the rooftop which is a great way to eat dinner and watch the sunset. The hotel also has an excellent business centre (use is free!) with high spec computers with colour laser printer, cd burners, internet access etc. There is also a coin operated laundary and gym! Local calls are also free. Located only about 2 blocks from Seattle Centre it was ideal and in a great neighbourhood (better than downtown!). And don't worry about catching the bus downtown, just walk 5 minutes and get the monorail! It is fabulous and really quick. Tip: Ask for a room not on the first or second floor. The first floor is road level and second floor (the rooms on the inner court yeard side) face directly into a court yard which makes is pretty public. If you are going to Seattle and don't mind staying out of downtown (only just!) stay at the Med. It is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again in an instant!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As soon as we checked in, I could tell that the staff was very attentive to details. We checked in quite early and aside from just assuming that our room was ready, one of the staff members went up to check on the room as well. We had a great view of the Space Needle! Loved the windows that opened and the complimentary popcorn, Cokes, and of course, Starbucks coffee in the room. The hotel has Wi-Fi in all rooms, as well as a very well-equipped business center and two more computers in the lobby for internet use. Oh, and of course, the beautiful rooftop deck with lots of Adirondack chairs! We stayed here for five nights, and while the rooms aren't huge, it was more than enough. The bathroom was bigger than I would have imagined and it came with lots of extra towels. We hope to make it back to Seattle again and when we do, I will stay here. It is close to all major bus lines. In fact, we took a bus to this hotel for a whopping $1.25 a person. You can't beat that! Excellent hotel, especially for the price! Skip looking at staying downtown and stay here. If you are not against riding the bus, it is very close to everything you could possibly want to see or do in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: carsonsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in May 2005. It was a great value and location. We would have liked to be closer to downtown but didn't want to pay those downtown prices!! The rooms are small but we only used them for sleeping. Loved the complimentary cokes and popcorn. Great view from the rooftop balconey.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Med!”
Reviews.Author: rplove5662
Reviews.Content: Location, quality, cleanliness, service---The Med has it all! I will definitely stay here again if I am lucky enough to return to Seattle. There was a grocery store (Safeway) across the street, countless restaurants nearby, and the bus was very close. They also gave us some plates to use in our room. The laundry room was clean and everything worked well. Secure and safe. Great rooftop views. Loved the Med!

Reviews.Title: “Great price but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off I want to say how great Seattle is as far as the people and the community and would recommend it as a place to visit. The hotel was very nice, very clean but my only real complaint was that the walls are PAPER THIN. I mean I could hear EVERYTHING that was said...and done in the room next to me. Luckily I brought earplugs but even then it was still a bit much. The location was greaat, in a very nice neighborhood with a grocery store right next door so I could go get inexpensive goodies to eat. Plenty of places to eat and an indie theatre on the corner. All around great except for the thin wall issue. Also great views on the roof of the space needle which is only two blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: drum-mama
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mediterranean Inn for 2 nights to attend a drum festival at the Seattle Center, 2 blocks away. My single room was very clean and comfortable, and some have views of the water if you ask. My friends were in a very large room with 2 queen beds, and a terrific view. You can ask for dishes and more cups and glasses to go with the fridge, microwave and sink. My room was very quiet at night, the staff was very friendly and they let us keep our van in the underground parking for the day after we checked out. There is not a restaurant in the hotel, just a Starbucks, but there are many restaurants and grocery stores within a few blocks. This was great value for the price and I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: zimmer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value and truely a great hotel. From the very clean rooms with very comfortable beds to the microwave and fridge in the room. We had Starbucks in the room with our coffee maker as well as complimentary cokes and microwave popcorn! The location is almost across the street from the seattle center which is close to the monorail and a bus stop. The people at the desk were very helpful on bus schedules as well as arranging a limo for $33 to the airport. I would definately recommend this hotel. Oh, and you are right next to the space needle for a great night view from the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Awesome rates for large, clean rooms and a great location. Has a roof top patio with views of the whole city. We had two cans of Coke and popcorn complimentary in our room. Close to everything!! Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay when you are in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Med last week and was very impressed! If you want to stay at a Hotel that has good location, staff, and creature comforts, this is the place. The Hotel staff is very friendly giving me advice on saving money while riding public transit and where to go and what to do. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The inn is also two blocks from Seattle Center which features, theaters, museums, sporting events, the Space Needle, as well as the very convenient downtown monorail which drops you off at Westlake Mall downtown, just a few blocks form Pike Place Market and other major Seattle attractions. I will stay at the Med whenever I visit Seattle in the future. Did I mention the views of downtown and Puget Sound from the rooftop terrace are incredible?!

Reviews.Title: “Rest your head at the med”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year and would happily recommend it again. The staff were friendly and helpful without being in-yer-face intrusive. The room was well lit, decorated and equip with everything we needed for our stay and more, the free Starbucks coffee was a lovely Seattle touch and the microwave and refrigeration facilities we requested were very useful, although somewhat unnecessary as Seattle’s fresh flavours shouldn’t be missed for a microwave meal… no matter how tight your travel budget. The location is fantastic, everything we wanted to see was commutable by foot or public transport (very near the monorail). As a side issue I’d also seriously recommend visitors buy the Seattle frommers guide for the walking tours of the city and surrounding neighbourhoods, they’re fantastically informative and fun… and with a landmark like that space needle as a reference point you need not worry about getting lost :) Enjoy this beautiful city and hotel I wish to visit again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be sure, stay here”
Reviews.Author: metalliam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Med over New Years and I was very impressed. Came over from England with my father to see my sister, we found this gem of a hotel on our own. You can get to the hotel bu shuttle bus from the Airport which runs all the time cheaper than you'd get a cab. Not much hassle involved, either. Once we got to the hotel and while we were there, the staff were top class. We booked a room with 2 single beds, room 605, and it's huge with a great view of the Queen Anne neighborhood and the Space Needle. After a 9 hour flight, the bed was great. They have Air Con now, too, a similar unit to others i've had before and been impressed with. The bus system in Seattle is brilliant, and i'd recommend it over the Monorail, which didn't actually work when I was there. Bus travel is cheap and effecient, there's a stop just across the street. If you walk a couple of blocks over, you can ride for free, but we wanted to save our legs. The hotel room comes with some nice amenities such as the Coke and the Popcorn, a fridge, Microwave and various other things. The rooms were very clean and had a homey feel. The location is great if you're a Sonics fan, the KeyArena is just minutes away, as is the Pacific Science Centre (fun) and the EMP (also fun if you're into rock music). The hotel also has some good Internet access, one quick pod just for browsing while standing, and another terminal in the business centre which has a 30 minute limit for longer Emails. There's a lot to do in the area itself, a fast food chain called Dicks across the street, friendly service and good burgers, there's a few restaurants up the street too. There's a QFC and Safeway right by too so you can stock up on certain things. I'd definitely want to stay here again the next time I come back to Seattle..i'll definitely be back, it's a great city.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel and its location--would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed just a couple nights this past weekend and we got a great deal on a hotel with a great location and room. It is located in lower Queen Anne which has several little shops and restaurants/bars/cinema in the area, or you can take a short walk uphill to Upper Queen Anne where you'll find the markets and more cute shops and restaurants. Also what is great is that you can walk from the hotel to the Seattle Center which has the Space Needle, The Monorail to get into town ($1.50 each way), The Experience Music Project ans Science Center, The Key Area (where the Seattle Sonics play basketball), and an amusement park. You could also walk to downtown Seattle or Belltown in 15-20 minutes. The hotel room is roomy enough with a kitchenette. Quiet also, free internet service, a small workout room, and a VCR in the room (with BlockBuster across the street). Also, Starbucks is located right off the lobby for those coffee fixes. We'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent place”
Reviews.Author: gabelou75
Reviews.Content: a great hotel with nice room and very interresting location. free internet access in the lobby and you can use printer totally free. in fact the best hotel in the city , for us.

HotelInfo.Name: Mediterranean Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 425 Queen Anne Avenue North, Seattle, WA 98109
